0.title: SBI denies no-dues certificate to farmer over 31 paise in Gujarat
0.article_body: The Gujarat High Court criticised SBI for withholding no-dues certificate of a farmer for pending dues worth 31 paise. The farmer needed the certificate for a land deal after he repaid the crop loan, TOI reported. "Outstanding of 31 paise? Do you know anything less than 50 paise is to be ignored?" Justice Bhargav Karia told SBI.

1.title: Shreya shares unseen pic with 'Scam 1992' co-star Pratik on his b'day
1.article_body: Actress Shreya Dhanwanthary, taking to Instagram Stories, shared an unseen picture with her 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story' co-star Pratik Gandhi on his birthday on Thursday. Along with the picture, she wrote, "It's this jigar's birthday...Happy Birthdaaaaay my favourite nemesis." Shreya played the role of journalist Sucheta Dalal in the web series, which was directed by Hansal Mehta.

2.title: Lack of planning: BJP to Jharkhand govt over power cuts
2.article_body: The BJP has accused the JMM-led Jharkhand government of failing to provide a steady supply of electricity and adequate water to people amid the heatwave, calling it a result of "lack of planning". Former Jharkhand CM and BJP leader Raghubar Das said, "Presently, Jharkhand requires 2,300 MW to 2,600 MW of power but is getting barely 1200 MW."

3.title: Imported oil first taxed by Centre then states: Pawar on fuel price hike
3.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that imported oil is first taxed by Centre and then states. Pawar added that Maharashtra decreased taxes on CNG due to which it suffered loss of ₹1,000 crore. He further said Centre should adopt uniform taxation policy on fuel in country.

4.title: Raj govt should review law & order: NCW chief on Dausa rape case
4.article_body: After a woman was allegedly gangraped and murdered in Rajasthan's Dausa, the National Commission for Women Chairperson, Rekha Sharma, said that the state government should review law and order. Sharma, who met police officials and the woman's family on Thursday, said, "People have no fear of law, it seems." She sought the arrest of all the accused at the earliest.

5.title: Superb VFX, brilliant acting & direction: Akshay on Ajay's Runway 34
5.article_body: Akshay Kumar praised 'Runway 34' on Twitter after the film's lead actor and director Ajay Devgn held a special screening for the actor. "Brother Ajay...What a thriller...superb VFX, brilliant acting and direction," he tweeted. "Amitabh Bachchan...effortless as always," he added. Akshay also praised actress Rakul Preet Singh's performance. "May the film gets its due," Akshay concluded.

6.title: Cong protects rioters: BJP after anti-Sikh riots accused Tytler meets Sonia
6.article_body: Reacting to 1984 anti-Sikh riots accused Jagdish Tytler's meeting with Congress' Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that the party "has always protected" and patronised rioters. "Congress will never stand for...victims of...riots...They have always rubbed salt on the wounds of...Sikh community," he added. The purpose of Tytler's visit, however, is not known.

7.title: Maha Minister Nawab Malik seeks interim bail on medical grounds
7.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case, has sought interim bail from a special PMLA court on medical grounds. He had informed the court that he was unwell due to kidney ailments and had swelling in his legs. Malik was arrested on February 23 in connection with a money laundering probe.

8.title: Have declared 16 AIIMS across India since 2014: PM Narendra Modi
8.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who visited Assam to lay foundation stone to various medical and developmental projects, said that his government has announced setting up of 16 AIIMS in the country after 2014. He added that AIIMS Guwahati was one of these projects. He tweeted, "Before 2014, there were only 7 AIIMS in the country. We declared 16 AIIMS across India."

9.title: 'Current health status: pissed off': Football superagent Raiola on reports of his death
9.article_body: After reports of his death surfaced online, football superagent Mino Raiola tweeted, "Current health status for the ones wondering: pissed off second time in 4 months they kill me. Seem also able to resuscitate." Raiola is currently admitted to the San Raffaele Hospital in Milan. Raiola's clients include Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Paul Pogba and Erling Haaland, among others.

10.title: 31-yr-old key accused in Jahangirpuri violence arrested from West Bengal
10.article_body: One of the main accused in communal violence that took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri has been arrested from West Bengal, a Delhi Police Crime Branch officer said. The accused, 31-year-old Farid alias Neetu, is "one of the conspirators" and was "seen firing at the other community", the officer added. Post-riots, he escaped and hid in Tamluk, the officer further said.

11.title: Amber Heard's old chats with agent about break up with Elon Musk shown in court
11.article_body: Amber Heard spent time with Elon Musk while trying to reconcile with Johnny Depp, the ex-couple's agent Christian Carino said. Some of Carino's texts with Heard were shown in court, with Heard complaining about her break up with Musk in one. "Why'd you be sad if you weren't in love with him...You told me...you were just filling space," Carino replied.

12.title: DC to bowl first against KKR, KKR make 3 changes to their playing XI
12.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). DC have made two changes to their playing XI, with Mitchell Marsh and Chetan Sakariya replacing Sarfaraz Khan and Khaleel Ahmed. KKR have made three changes, with Aaron Finch, Harshit Rana and Baba Indrajith being included in the side.

13.title: UP MLA scolds official for bulldozing house, says homes of poor shouldn't be razed
13.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing BJP MLA Ketki Singh scolding an official in UP's Ballia for bulldozing a poor family's home. Singh could be heard saying, "I said one thing...why didn't you respect it?...[You used bulldozer's strength...we'll use the words' strength]." Later, Singh said that UP CM Yogi Adityanath has said that homes of poor shouldn't be razed.

14.title: Twitter reports revenue miss, user growth for Q1 days after Musk deal
14.article_body: Days after agreeing to sell to Elon Musk for $44 billion, Twitter released its earnings report for Q1 2022 on Thursday. Its daily active users number was up by 15.9% y-o-y to 229 million, compared with analysts' estimates of 226.8 million. However, Twitter's revenue was slightly below the estimated $1.23 billion. It earned $1.2 billion, an increase of 16% y-o-y.

15.title: Tempo driver arrested for raping 7-year-old girl in Mumbai
15.article_body: Mumbai police said that a tempo driver was arrested for luring a seven-year-old girl with chocolate and raping her in Ghatkopar. Officials said the 35-year-old accused was arrested within 24 hours of the incident. "Accused has been booked under section 376 (rape) and other relevant provisions of the IPC and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act," they added.

16.title: Elon Musk will not testify in Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's defamation trial
16.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk will not be testifying as a witness in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, the billionaire's lawyer Alex Spiro stated. Earlier, reports had said that Musk, who reportedly dated Amber in 2016, could be testifying in the court. Depp had alleged that Amber began dating Musk while she was still married to the actor.

17.title: Chennai man asks for sexual favours from woman during interview, held
17.article_body: The Greater Chennai Police on Wednesday arrested a 48-year-old man for allegedly demanding sexual favours from a woman during a job interview at his firm. The accused told the woman that in order to be selected, she would have to accompany him when he travels for outstation work and would have to share the room with him, police said.

18.title: NCB seize 50 kg of heroin, ₹30 lakh cash from Delhi's Jamia Nagar
18.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Wednesday seized about 50 kg of "high-quality" heroin, 47 kg of other suspected drugs and ₹30 lakh in cash from Delhi's Jamia Nagar, the agency said on Thursday. The drugs were kept in backpacks, jute bags and wrapped in packets of e-commerce firms, said NCB Deputy Director General (operations) Sanjay Kumar Singh.

19.title: Attempt being made to disturb communal harmony in India: Pawar
19.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that an attempt was being made to disturb communal harmony in the country. He said the Centre wasn't doing enough to control troublemakers in Delhi. Speaking about the Jahangirpuri violence, he said, "There were attacks on a particular section of the society. There was a conspiracy to spoil peace in the country."

20.title: Prashant Kishor's proposal had nothing on leadership: P Chidambaram
20.article_body: After poll strategist Prashant Kishor declined Congress' offer to join the party, senior leader P Chidambaram said that Prashant Kishor's proposals to restore the party had nothing regarding its leadership. "PK plan had nothing on leadership issue. Didn't hear of any Priyanka for president proposal either," he said. Kishor rejected Congress' proposal after various meetings with Congress leaders.

21.title: BJP didn't fight enough, workers felt abandoned: WB BJP MP
21.article_body: West Bengal BJP MP Arjun Singh said BJP didn't win the state's Assembly polls last year because "it didn't fight enough". "BJP lost [the Assembly polls] because of poor candidate selection...Organisationally, the party is very weak. It is evident from what we recently saw in Asansol," Singh said. "Many workers felt they were abandoned [during] the post-poll violence," he added.

22.title: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates 7 new cancer hospitals in Assam
22.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, along with industrialist Ratan Tata, inaugurated a cancer care centre and seven new cancer hospitals in Assam on Thursday. PM Modi said, "Cancer hospitals in Assam will augment healthcare capacities in Northeast [and] South Asia." He, however, added, "Hospitals are at your service, but I'll be happy if these new hospitals remain empty...I pray for your health."

23.title: Supplying Ukraine with weapons is threat to Europe's security: Russia
23.article_body: Russia said on Thursday that the West supplying arms to Ukraine poses a threat to Europe's security. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov's remarks came in response to UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss' comments on how countries should pledge more ammunition to Ukraine. Notably, Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned of "lightning-fast" retaliatory strikes to any foreign interference in Ukraine war.

24.title: 'Jiju threatening to call off marriage' says man on delay in car delivery; Tata replies
24.article_body: Tata Motors responded to a man complaining over delay in his car's delivery. He tweeted, "It's [been] more than 2 months...dealer has no idea on delivery date. My sister's marriage is at stake, My jiju is angry and threatening to call off marriage." Tata sought his contact details and wrote, "We never want our customers to have such an experience."

25.title: 171 students tested positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras in 10 days
25.article_body: Twenty-six more people tested positive for COVID-19 at the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras on Thursday, taking the number up to 171 since the virus was first reported on April 19. "The number of positive cases is reducing day by day and the sample testing process is set to conclude likely today (Thursday)," said Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan.

26.title: Bitcoin adopted as legal tender in Central African Republic
26.article_body: The Central African Republic has adopted Bitcoin as legal tender, a spokesperson for President Faustin-Archange Touadera told Bloomberg on Thursday. "By legalising the use of Bitcoin, CAR hopes to attract investors," the spokesperson stated. Notably, it is the first African and only the second country in the world to do so after El Salvador, which adopted Bitcoin in September 2021.

27.title: Trump's Truth Social exists as Twitter censored free speech: Musk
27.article_body: Ex-US President Donald Trump's social media platform Truth Social exists because "Twitter censored free speech", Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, said. However, he added that Truth Social is a "terrible" name and it should be called "Trumpet" instead. As per its website, Truth Social intends to give users space for "open, free and honest global conversation".

28.title: Only love & item songs are coming out from India: Grammy winner Ricky
28.article_body: Two-time Grammy Award winner Ricky Kej said he's chosen not to compose songs in Bollywood. The Indian composer stated he prefers making music from the heart. Ricky added, "While the quality of [film] music is very good, people aren't making music from the heart. The only type of music coming out from India are either item songs or love songs."

29.title: Russian-controlled region of Ukraine to start using rouble: Official
29.article_body: Ukraine's Kherson region, which has fallen to Russia amid invasion, will start using rouble as its currency from May 1, a pro-Russian committee official said. The official, Kirill Stremouso, stated that transition to rouble will take up to four months, during which time, Ukrainian currency will also be used. This comes amid reports of impending referendum by Russia in region.

30.title: Lucky to finish: Horner on Leclerc after spin during Emilia Romagna GP
30.article_body: Red Bull boss Christian Horner said Ferrari's Charles Leclerc was "lucky to finish the race" after spinning during the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix and finishing in sixth-place. Leclerc was chasing Red Bull's Sergio Perez before spinning off the track. "It just looked like he got a little bit too greedy on that Soft tyre, but mistakes can happen," Horner said.

31.title: I'm performing my last rites today: Mumbai man to wife before suicide
31.article_body: A lab assistant died by suicide after he appeared in front of a local train on Monday morning in Mumbai. Reportedly, two hours before the suicide, the man called his wife and said, "Today, I am performing my last rites [and] you perform your last rites." According to a report, the man killed himself due to a family dispute.

32.title: Nilekani helping govt build platform to take on Amazon, Flipkart: Report
32.article_body: Infosys' billionaire Co-founder Nandan Nilekani is helping the government build "a freely accessible online system where traders and consumers can buy and sell everything from detergent bars to airline tickets," Bloomberg reported. It is called the Open Network for Digital Commerce, or ONDC. Its objective is to curb Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart's domination in India, Bloomberg report added.

33.title: I feel sad for Sangram as I can't get pregnant, he loves kids: Payal
33.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Payal Rohatgi broke down on the reality show and revealed that she cannot get pregnant. "We're trying [for] 4-5 years to have kids, I tried IVF, nahi ho raha (but it doesn't happen)," she stated. "I feel sad for Sangram because he loves kids, I can't have kids, he deserves to have his own kids," Payal added.

34.title: Amid loudspeaker row, MVA leaders to hold rally in Pune on April 30
34.article_body: Amid controversy over usage of loudspeakers at religious places, Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) leaders will hold rally in Pune on April 30. This comes a day before Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) leader Raj Thackeray is slated to hold rally in Aurangabad. Our rally will counter BJP and MNS' "bitterness" amid their demand to pull down loudspeakers, a Congress leader said.

35.title: Delhi govt to increase water supply to meet growing demand in summer
35.article_body: The Delhi government on Thursday said it will supply around 1,000 million gallons of drinking water every day during summer as against 935 MGD earlier to meet the rising demand. "The system has been made efficient and robust so that there is no water scarcity in the summer season. The Water Minister is personally monitoring the situation," a statement said.

36.title: I'm going to take a break from acting for a little bit: Andrew Garfield
36.article_body: Andrew Garfield, during an interview, said he'll be taking a break from acting. "I'm going to rest for a little bit...I need to recalibrate...reconsider what I want to do next and who I want to be and just be a bit of a person for a while," he stated. Recently, Andrew earned his second Oscar nomination for 'Tick, tick...BOOM!'.

37.title: Venkatesh's only scored one 50 so far, he has to gain clarity: Lynn
37.article_body: Ex-KKR opener Chris Lynn said KKR's all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer has only scored one half-century so far in IPL 2022, and needs to try and gain some clarity when he walks out to bat. "The challenge for him is to...go back to the drawing board, build some confidence," added Lynn. Venkatesh has scored 126 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

38.title: Meta's shares surge 19% as Facebook reports user growth in Q1 2022
38.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta's shares surged 19% during pre-market trading in New York, a day after it reported that Facebook added more users than projected in Q1 2022. Facebook had 1.96 billion daily users in Q1 2022, a return to growth after its first-ever decline in Q4 2021, Meta reported on Wednesday. Meta's shares climbed as high as $210.14/share following the report.

39.title: 22,800 Russian soldiers killed in conflict so far, says Ukraine
39.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Ministry on Thursday claimed that around 22,800 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Ukrainian forces have destroyed 970 Russian tanks and over 340 aircraft, including 155 helicopters, it added. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 2,389 armoured personnel carriers, 431 artillery systems and 151 multiple launch rocket systems.

40.title: Russia-Ukraine conflict has shown being self-reliant is a necessity: Rajnath
40.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the Russia-Ukraine conflict has highlighted that being "self-reliant without dependencies" is a vital necessity. Indian Navy, which has been at the forefront of the government's 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' initiative, must continue to lead the way, he added. He further informed that Indian Navy trained over 19,000 foreign personnel in the last four decades.

41.title: People didn't know Umran till IPL 2021, now everyone waits for him: Nikhil
41.article_body: Talking about SRH pacer Umran Malik, ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said, "Until last year, most people didn't know him but everyone waits for him...this season." "Umran [has] got that 'X-factor'. He has the ability and pace and will be an asset for Team India in T20 World Cup 2022," added Nikhil. Umran recorded a five-wicket haul against GT.

42.title: AAP's Atishi to speak on Delhi govt's policies at UNGA
42.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Atishi will speak on the Delhi government policies at the United Nations General Assembly in a meeting on the 'New Urban Agenda'. "This is a great opportunity for governments to learn from one another and help people all over the world through policies that are closely connected to the needs of citizens," she said.

43.title: 35 kg heroin worth ₹175 crore seized during raids in Delhi, UP
43.article_body: In a joint operation, the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad and a team of Delhi NCB seized 35 kilograms of heroin worth ₹175 crore from Delhi and UP's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday. Moreover, four persons have been arrested in connection with the matter. Earlier on April 25, the Gujarat ATS seized over 50 kilograms of heroin worth ₹280 crore from a Pakistani boat.

44.title: PM Modi shares aerial pics of Brahmaputra river, calls it 'lifeline for Assam people'
44.article_body: During his visit to Assam on Thursday, PM Narendra Modi tweeted aerial pictures of the Brahmaputra river. "While on the way to Dibrugarh, caught a few glimpses of the magnificent Brahmaputra, which is a lifeline for the people of Assam and is an integral part of Assam's history and culture," he wrote with the pictures.

45.title: Taiwan records over 11,000 COVID-19 cases, highest so far
45.article_body: Taiwan saw a record number of single-day COVID-19 cases as it registered 11,353 infections on Thursday. Health Minister Shih-Chung Chen said that 99.7% of the infected patients had mild or no symptoms. Earlier this month, the government ended its "zero-COVID" policy despite the rise in the number of cases since late March.

46.title: Villarreal boss Emery warns Liverpool will 'suffer' in CL 2nd-leg clash
46.article_body: Villarreal manager Unai Emery said Liverpool "will suffer more" in the second-leg of their Champions League semi-final clash after Liverpool won the first-leg 2-0 on Wednesday. "The match next week will be very different than tonight. It's very important in our home to change something, maybe tactically," Emery said. "We can't dispute the result because they deserve it," he added.

47.title: Four black fungus cases reported in Bengaluru hospital
47.article_body: Amid surge in COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru, four patients have shown black fungus symptoms in city's Manipal Hospital. "Mucormycosis and Aspergillus are present in black fungus cases. Mucormycosis is more aggressive than Aspergillus. The treatment...for both types is anti-fungal medication," Senior Consultant, ENT, Dr Santosh Shivaswamy, said. On Wednesday, Bengaluru reported 114 COVID-19 cases.

48.title: 20 dead, thousands flee homes as gangs battle in Haiti
48.article_body: At least 20 people have been killed as violence in several neighbourhoods in the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince worsened this week. The violence has forced thousands of people to flee their homes. Gangs have ramped up their battle for control over areas beyond their poorer neighbourhoods amid the power vacuum following the assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse in July.

49.title: Union Minister explains why air ticket prices haven't come down
49.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday asked if people ever wondered why air ticket prices haven't come down. Stating that Aviation Turbine Fuel constitutes about 40% of airline operations cost, Puri tweeted, "West Bengal, Maharashtra & Delhi impose massive 25%+ VAT on ATF while BJP states UP & Nagaland; & UT of J&K charge just 1%," he tweeted.

50.title: Shehnaaz to make her B'wood debut with Salman's 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
50.article_body: Actress, former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Shehnaaz Gill will reportedly make her Bollywood debut with Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. According to reports, the actress has joined the cast of the film and will be seen opposite actor Aayush Sharma. Speaking about the project, Aayush had said that he's looking forward to experimenting with his "cinematic aptitude" with this film.

51.title: T'gana Minister inaugurates Thermo Fisher's R&D facility in Hyd
51.article_body: Telangana Minister for IT and Industries KT Rama Rao (KTR) on Thursday inaugurated the Thermo Fisher research and engineering centre's India Engineering Centre (IEC) in Hyderabad. Thermo Fisher's IEC is being set up with an investment of about $15 million (₹1,14,89,70,000) and will employ over 450 diversely talented engineers and vendor partners.

52.title: It's a ridiculous turf war: Prakash on Devgn-Sudeep's national language debate
52.article_body: Actor Prakash Belawadi, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files', spoke about the recent national language debate between Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep. Prakash said it looks like a "ridiculous turf war". "Hindi isn't a national language because there's no designated national language in India...To convert this into an identity battle of your language versus my language is ridiculous," he added.

53.title: Bowlers are putting Kohli in a spot, letting him make a mistake: Vettori
53.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli who has scored 128 runs in IPL 2022 so far, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "The bowler is putting Kohli in a spot and letting him make a mistake." "You...got to be all-out aggressive," added Vettori. Kohli was dismissed for nine off 10 balls against RR, having recorded two consecutive golden ducks before that.

54.title: EU nations paying for Russian gas in rubles must be penalised: Poland
54.article_body: Poland's Climate Minister Anna Moskwa said that the European Union should penalise countries that use rubles to pay for Russian gas. This comes after Russia's energy firm Gazprom on Wednesday halted gas exports to Poland and Bulgaria over the countries' refusal to pay for supplies in Russian currency. Reportedly, four European gas buyers have paid for supplies in rubles.

55.title: Meta reports 21% drop in profits in 2nd straight quarterly decline
55.article_body: Facebook parent Meta reported a 21% y-o-y decline in its profit for Q1 2022 at $7.5 billion, marking the company's second consecutive quarterly decline. Meta's revenue however grew 7% to $27.91 billion from $26.17 billion. Meanwhile, Facebook's daily active user count also increased 4% y-o-y to 1.96 billion after declining in Q4 2021 for the first time.

56.title: UP villagers thrash leopard to death after it attacks people in fields
56.article_body: Villagers in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich thrashed a leopard with sticks and killed it after it attacked some people working in the fields. Thirteen people, including three women were injured in the incident. Some villagers also attacked the forest officials who had come to catch the leopard. An official said they are trying to identify the villagers who attacked the staff.

57.title: BJP claims 8 of the top 10 states with highest fuel prices are non-BJP ruled states
57.article_body: BJP has shared a list claiming that eight of the top 10 states with highest petrol and diesel prices in the country are non-BJP ruled states. According to BJP, Andhra Pradesh occupies the top spot where petrol was sold at ₹121.4/litre and diesel at ₹107/ litre on April 6. Madhya Pradesh and Bihar are also included in the list.

58.title: I've practiced choosing balls, bowlers to attack in death overs: Tewatia
58.article_body: GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia has revealed that since getting the finisher's role in IPL, he has practiced choosing bowlers and balls to attack during the death overs. Against SRH, Tewatia came in to bat when GT were 122/3 and needed 74 runs to win off 40 balls. He then scored 40*(21) to help his side chase down the 195-run total.

59.title: Staff preoccupied, not available for demolition drive: Delhi Police
59.article_body: The Delhi Police on Thursday wrote to the South Delhi Municipal Corporation stating the officials were preoccupied to assist SDMC staff in carrying out an anti-encroachment drive in Sarita Vihar. "It is requested that prior intimation of at least 10 days may be given to fix the date for encroachment removal drive in the area," Delhi Police said.

60.title: Chhattisgarh govt to celebrate 'Mati Poojan Diwas' to promote natural farming
60.article_body: Chhattisgarh government announced on Wednesday that it will celebrate 'Mati Poojan Diwas' on May 3 to promote natural farming. According to a government circular, farmers and people would be encouraged to use vermicompost, cow urine and organic fertilisers instead of chemical ones. The programmes will be held at various panchayat levels as well as on the state level in Raipur.

61.title: 8 months' GST compensation sent to states, ₹78,704 cr pending: Govt
61.article_body: Finance Ministry on Wednesday said the Centre has released eight months of GST compensation for FY22 to states and compensation worth ₹78,704 crore is pending due to inadequate balance in the cess fund. During GST's implementation in 2017, Centre had agreed to compensate states till June 2022. It added that ₹7.35 lakh crore has been released to compensate revenue loss.

62.title: Actor Salim Ghouse passes away aged 70 due to cardiac arrest
62.article_body: Film and TV actor Salim Ghouse passed away aged 70 in Mumbai after suffering cardiac arrest. The last rites of the actor were performed early on Thursday morning. Ghouse started his acting journey in 1978 with the movie 'Swarg Narak', following which he featured in films like 'Chakra' and 'Saaransh'. He also featured in the TV show 'Bharat Ek Khoj'.

63.title: What are the highest targets achieved in the 20th over in IPL?
63.article_body: GT on Wednesday successfully chased down 22 runs required to win off the 20th over. It's the second-highest target achieved in the 20th over in IPL. RPS successfully chased down 23 runs off the last over against PBKS in IPL 2016 to record the highest target achieved in last over. Deccan Chargers, MI and RCB have chased down 21 runs.

64.title: Sleep with me or I'll get 20 more men: Russian soldier to pregnant teen before raping her
64.article_body: A 16-year-old pregnant girl in Ukraine's Kherson has revealed that she was threatened by a Russian soldier before he raped her. "When I resisted, he strangled me and said he'll kill me. Then he issued an unimaginable threat. He said either you sleep with me now, or I will bring 20 more people." the girl said.

65.title: Twitter-Musk deal includes $1 billion termination fee for both the parties
65.article_body: Elon Musk will have to pay Twitter a fee of $1 billion if he terminates his $44 billion cash deal for the social media company, according to a regulatory filing. Twitter will have to pay the same fee under specified circumstances if it terminates the deal. The deal could be terminated if not closed by October 24, the filing added.

66.title: Only 2 people have quit our tech team in 10 years: Zerodha's CTO
66.article_body: Unicorn startup Zerodha's CTO Kailash Nadh told Moneycontrol, "We have a technology team of just 33 people." He added, "Only two people have quit tech team in 10 years...that too for personal reasons." He explained, "We've kept it really simple, grounded and realistic...Aspirants are usually sold a vision about changing the lives of billions of people, we don't do that."

67.title: PL launches scheme to aid progress of South Asian football players
67.article_body: The Premier League has launched a scheme to aid the progress of young football players with South Asian backgrounds. It aims to improve coaching, playing and executive pathways for Asian, black and minority ethnic groups. Data from the Professional Footballers' Association shows there are 16 professional footballers with British South Asian heritage in the top four tiers of English football.

68.title: Andaman & Nicobar to get renewable energy-based power supply project
68.article_body: The central government will set up a renewable energy-based power supply project in Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The centre had signed a grant agreement with the Japan International Cooperation Agency to provide loan of $133 million in March for the same. The project, which will help in reducing the islands' carbon footprint, is expected to be completed by February 2024.

69.title: 2 Indian-origin men get jail for lying about vaccine status in Singapore
69.article_body: A Singapore court sentenced two Indian-origin men to five days in prison after one of them lied about his vaccination status to enter a bar. One of the accused, identified as 65-year-old Utheyakumar Nallathamby, had impersonated the other co-accused as he was unvaccinated and used the latter's credentials to enter bar. Nallathamby was caught after bar's assistant manager spotted him.

70.title: RCB share pics from ethnic-themed wedding party for Glenn Maxwell, Vini Raman
70.article_body: RCB took to Instagram to share pictures from ethnic-themed wedding party for Glenn Maxwell and Vini Raman. "Wedding vibes at the RCB camp last evening as we got together to celebrate #MaxiVins with a nice touch of Indian tradition," RCB wrote. The duo got married last month. Vini is an Indian-origin pharmacist based in Melbourne.

71.title: Praying for the safety of our Muslim brothers & sisters in India: German footballer Özil
71.article_body: German footballer Mesut Özil took to Twitter and wrote, "Praying during...holy night of Lailat al-Qadr for safety and well-being of our Muslim brothers and sisters in India." He added, "Let's spread awareness to this shameful situation! What is happening to the human rights in the so-called largest democracy in the world? #BreakTheSilence."

72.title: Finland and Sweden could join NATO quickly: Stoltenberg
72.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said Finland and Sweden will be able to join the military alliance "quickly" if they apply for membership. NATO would also try to find ways to ensure the two countries' security from the time they apply until they formally join, he added. Russia has threatened to deploy nuclear weapons to Baltics if the countries join NATO.

73.title: Congress leader Kamal Nath resigns as Leader of Opposition in MP
73.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath has resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Madhya Pradesh. Nath's resignation has been accepted by the Congress high command, All India Congress Committee General Secretary KC Venugopal said. Dr Govind Singh will be the Leader of the Congress Legislature Party in Madhya Pradesh, the Congress party said.

74.title: Sister asked 'Are you still in the film': Taapsee on working with SRK in Dunki
74.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu spoke about signing 'Dunki' alongside Shah Rukh Khan. She said, "It's too good to be true. I never...thought that I'll...someday reach this, forget about so soon." Taapsee revealed not just her, even her sister, Shagun Pannu, couldn't believe it. "Each time I went for [any] meeting with Rajkumar (Hirani)...she asked me, 'Are you still in the film'?"

75.title: Don't want to give her any importance: Ali Merchant on ex-wife Sara Khan
75.article_body: After Ali Merchant's ex-wife Sara Khan blamed him for her early eviction from 'Lock Upp', Merchant said, "[There were] claims that I was on the show because of her, well, tables have turned. Now she needs me to get the limelight." "I don't even want to give her any importance as it's not worth it," he added.

76.title: Liverpool’s Klopp hails ‘world class’ Mane after CL win over Villarreal
76.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp hailed forward Sadio Mane after the Senegalese scored to help Liverpool beat Villarreal in their Champions League semi-final first-leg clash on Wednesday. "He can play left, he can play central, both positions world class," Klopp said. Mane, 30, has scored 20 goals in 44 appearances for Liverpool so far this season.

77.title: It's easy to be politically neutral: Billionaire Cuban to Musk
77.article_body: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban in response to Elon Musk's comment on making Twitter "politically neutral" said, "It's easy to be politically neutral. It's hard to be neutral about health and safety issues." Earlier, Musk said that to "deserve" the public's trust, Twitter "must be politically neutral". He added that it "effectively means upsetting the far-right and...far-left equally".

78.title: Russia-Ukraine war could last as long as 10 years: UK
78.article_body: United Kingdom's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss has said that the Russia-Ukraine war could last as long as 10 years. She further said that if Russian President Vladimir Putin succeeds "there will be untold further misery across Europe and terrible consequences across the globe". Truss in her speech called Putin a "desperate rogue operator".

79.title: 'Avatar 2' to release on Dec 16, film's footage screened at CinemaCon
79.article_body: The release date of James Cameron's 'Avatar: The Way of Water' has officially been announced at CinemaCon 2022. The film, which will be a sequel to the 2009 film 'Avatar', will release on December 16. Two scenes of the upcoming film were shown at the CinemaCon. 'Avatar: The Way of Water' will feature Sam Worthington and Zoe Saldana.

80.title: I'm concerned but not overly: Deep Dasgupta on Rohit and Virat's form
80.article_body: On being asked if Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's form in the ongoing IPL season is a matter of concern, Deep Dasgupta said, "I'm not overly concerned...because it's different when you play for your country and when you play for franchises." In IPL 2022, Kohli has scored 128 runs in nine games while Rohit has scored 153 in eight matches.

81.title: South Korea to send gas to Europe amid energy crisis: Report
81.article_body: South Korea has decided to share liquefied natural gas (LNG) with European countries amid the energy crisis owing to restricted supply of Russian gas over Ukraine war, a report said quoting government officials. The country has the capability for providing such support in spring, however, the volume of shipment will "not be that much", according to an official.

82.title: Kohli got inner edges that missed the stumps vs RR, it's a worry: Bhogle
82.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle said Virat Kohli got inner edges that missed the stumps during his knock of 9 off 10 balls in RCB's defeat by 29 runs against RR, which is a worry. "Kohli is just not able to get away in the powerplay," added Bhogle. "Keep backing him and hope that at some point the fine-tuning happens," stated Bhogle.

83.title: There's no area in Kashmir that is free from militancy: Omar Abdullah
83.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir is passing through a difficult phase, Omar Abdullah, former Jammu and Kashmir CM, said on Thursday. "The security situation is a cause of concern. There's no area in Kashmir that is free from militancy," Abdullah added. "There is very little economic activity, barring tourism. Jammu and Kashmir has high unemployment levels," Abdullah stated.

84.title: 18-year-old boy develops AI, sensor-based bicycle counter in B'luru
84.article_body: Bengaluru-based 18-year-old boy, Nihar Thakkar, has developed an artificial intelligence and sensor-based bicycle counter, which is said to be the first in India. The counter has been installed in Doddanekundi. He said, "[It's] powered by an AI-sensor camera and a machine learning-based algorithm where the data provided can be used to encourage cycling and to build more dedicated cycle lanes."

85.title: Indonesia export ban traps 2.9 lakh tonnes of palm oil for India: Report
85.article_body: Indonesia's palm oil export ban has trapped at least 2.9 lakh tonnes of palm oil shipments headed to India, Reuters reported citing industry officials. The widening of Indonesia's export ban and the consequent shipment disruptions will create vegetable oil shortage in India, the officials added. This comes shortly after India faced sunflower oil import shortages due to the Russia-Ukraine war.

86.title: 12-yr-old girl complains of back pain in UK, X-ray shows spine curved at 80-degree angle
86.article_body: A 12-year-old girl who complained about shoulder and back pain has been recommended urgent surgery by doctors in UK after an X-ray revealed her spine was curved at an 80-degree angle. The girl's mother said that the 12-year-old had rapid onset progression scoliosis. "If the bend starts going even further it can start crushing her lungs and heart," she added.

87.title: 1 in 5 reptiles found worldwide is threatened with extinction: Study
87.article_body: One-fifth of the reptile species found worldwide are threatened with extinction, a study stated. Out of the 10,196 reptile species examined, 21% are critically endangered, endangered or vulnerable to extinction as defined by International Union for Conservation of Nature. The threatened species include Galapagos tortoises, Indonesia's Komodo dragon, Africa's rhinoceros viper, India's gharial etc.

88.title: 12-yr-old B'deshi boy, who unknowingly entered India, reunited with family
88.article_body: A 12-year-old Bangladeshi boy, who unknowingly entered the Indian territory, was reunited with his family on Wednesday. The boy had entered India while sleeping in an Indian export truck that was parked in the area where he was playing with other children in Bangladesh. He was handed over to Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) following paperwork, a BSF official said.

89.title: Russia says it will wait & see how Musk's ownership affects Twitter
89.article_body: Russian spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday that Russia will wait and see how billionaire Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter will affect the platform. He also said that he doubted Western social media's capability to reflect different points of view. The statement comes as a Russian court reportedly fined Twitter $41,000 for not removing banned content from its site.

90.title: Probe into Bible-in-school row hurtful: Bengaluru Archbishop
90.article_body: Reacting to the probe ordered by the Karnataka government into the Bible row in the state, Bengaluru's Archbishop Peter Machado said, "I feel very hurt." "No student of any other religion had converted while studying in Christian schools," he added. He further said non-Christian students were not required to read the Bible and no Bible instructions were issued for them.

91.title: SSB Jawan blackmails, rapes 24-yr-old woman in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
91.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have booked a Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) jawan for allegedly raping a 24-year-old woman in Lakhimpur Kheri. The woman alleged that the jawan took her photos while she was bathing and also recorded a video of her in the bathroom. He blackmailed her and forced her to have sexual relations with him, she claimed in her complaint.

92.title: Panchkula woman trying to book chopper tickets online cheated of ₹2.2 lakh
92.article_body: A Panchkula resident was cheated of ₹2.2 lakh by a fraudster while trying to book a helicopter ride for Char Dham Yatra with her family. The complainant said she came across a website and submitted her contact details there. "We were told to pay 50% of ticket charges in advance and remaining amount two days before chopper ride," she stated.

93.title: Will wait for NTAGI's suggestion to vaccinate 5 to 12-year-olds: Govt
93.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday said the Centre will wait for National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation's (NTAGI) recommendation to begin vaccination of 5-12-year-olds. This comes after Biological E's Corbevax and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin received emergency use authorisation for children aged 5-12 and 6-12 respectively. Vaccination for minors in India began on January 3.

94.title: If Pant is an MS Dhoni fan, he should learn from him: Virender Sehwag
94.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said DC captain Rishabh Pant should learn from former CSK captain MS Dhoni, if he is a fan of Dhoni. "Pant has the ability to score 20-25 runs in the final over, but for that he has to be at the crease," added Sehwag. Pant has scored 188 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

95.title: 33-yr-old BSF constable shoots himself dead in Chhattisgarh's Kanker
95.article_body: A 33-year-old Border Security Force (BSF) constable allegedly died by suicide by shooting himself with his service weapon in Chhattisgarh's Kanker, police said. The incident took place on Thursday morning at the BSF camp in Kamtera, police added. "On hearing the gunshot, his colleagues rushed to the spot and found him lying dead in a pool of blood," police stated.

96.title: US is 'out of pandemic phase' of COVID-19: Anthony Fauci
96.article_body: Top US health expert Dr Anthony Fauci said the US is "out of the pandemic phase" of COVID-19. "We are much, much better off than we were a year ago," Fauci said. "There's a lot of viral dynamics throughout the world and we still may get another variant which could lead to another potential surge," he added.

97.title: Air India's four Boeing 747 jets used for VIP travel deregistered
97.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has deregistered four Boeing 747 jumbo jets of Tata-owned Air India. DGCA said if Air India wants to use these aircrafts again for commercial flights, they'll have to undergo a return-to-service programme for re-registration. Till about two years ago, these 30-year-old jets were being used by the President, Vice President and Prime Minister.

98.title: Weren't told one religion will get preferential treatment in India: Omar
98.article_body: National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah said, "When we decided to accede to India, we acceded to a country where every religion would be treated equally. We were not told that one religion will get preferential treatment and others will be suppressed." He added that decision perhaps would have been different if people knew about it.

99.title: Delhi's Benito Juarez Marg underpass to be opened in May: Sisodia
99.article_body: Benito Juarez Marg underpass will be opened to the public next month, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said after he reviewed work on the stretch near South Campus. Once completed, the 1.8 km-long underpass is expected to provide relief to nearly 2.5 lakh commuters and travel to the airport and Gurugram will become smooth and traffic-free.

100.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Delhi; 7 arrested
100.article_body: A sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a spa and massage parlour has been busted in Delhi's East Patel Nagar, police said on Wednesday. After receiving a tip-off, police carried out a raid at the massage parlour, 'The Space Spa', and arrested seven persons, including five women. Police have also recovered obscene material from the spot.

101.title: Pune ZP primary education dept to give 15% fee waiver to students
101.article_body: The primary education department of Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) on Tuesday issued a notification stating that it will implement a 15% fee waiver for the academic year 2021-22 across all schools under its jurisdiction. Additionally, schools cannot halt online classes for a child if their parents were unable to pay the fees during the pandemic, an official said.

102.title: Had bad relationship after Romiit Raaj, realised I'm happy single: Shilpa Shinde
102.article_body: Television actress Shilpa Shinde, who was engaged to actor Romiit Raaj a few years ago said she realised she is happy being single. "After my engagement broke off...I did get into another relationship...that was very bad experience...I've realised I am happy being single...If someone asks me...where I am going or what I am doing...I can't keep answering him," she added.

103.title: SC upholds 6 years minimum age condition for Class 1 admissions in KVs
103.article_body: The Supreme Court rejected pleas challenging the raising of the minimum age required for admissions to Class 1 in Kendriya Vidyalayas to six years. The new rule will be applicable from 2022-2023 academic year. Earlier, the Delhi High Court had upheld the move by Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan, after which some parents took it up with the apex court.

104.title: Staff not available for anti-encroachment drive: Delhi Police to SDMC
104.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday wrote to South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) stating that its staff is preoccupied and not available for the anti-encroachment drive in one of its wards. "It's requested that prior intimation of at least 10 days may be given to fix the date for encroachment removal drive in the area of Sarita Vihar Police Station," police added.

105.title: Ben Stokes named England's new Test captain
105.article_body: All-rounder Ben Stokes has been appointed captain of England's Test team by the England & Wales Cricket Board. Stokes succeeds Joe Root in becoming the 81st captain of England's Test team. "I am honoured to be given the chance to lead the England Test team. This is a real privilege and I’m excited about getting started this summer," Stokes said.

106.title: Funding for football in India drops by almost 85% in 4 years due to poor performance
106.article_body: The government has slashed its funding to the All India Football Federation (AIFF) by almost 85% over the last four years, citing 'poor performance' of the team. AIFF has seen its grants under Annual Calendar of Training and Competitions (ACTC) fall from ₹30 crore for 2019-20 to ₹10 crore in 2020-21 and further down to ₹5 crore this year.

107.title: Malaika Arora shares pic showing scar on her forehead after car accident
107.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora took to Instagram Stories to share a picture which shows a scar on her forehead. The actress had met with a car accident on April 2 and was taken to the hospital after she received an injury near her eye. Earlier, speaking about the accident, she had said, "I was in shock...There was too much blood."

108.title: He taught for 50 yrs, doesn't own land: Padma Shri awardee's daughter on eviction
108.article_body: The daughter of 91-year-old Odissi dancer Guru Mayadhar Raut, who was evicted by Centre from bungalow allotted on rent in Delhi's Asiad village in the 1980s, said she was serving lunch when officials arrived. "This is how brutally you treat this legend. He taught in Delhi for 50 years, and doesn't own an inch of land anywhere," said Madhumita Raut.

109.title: Human activity is leading to more disasters: UN report
109.article_body: Human activity is leading to an increase in number of disasters worldwide, a new UN report released on Tuesday stated. According to the report, between 350 and 500 medium-sized to major disasters were recorded annually over the last two decades. Humans have put themselves into a spiral of self-destruction by heating up the climate and ignoring risks, the report stated.

110.title: Plane's tyre bursts while landing in B'luru; 150 passengers escape unhurt
110.article_body: Around 150 passengers onboard a Thai Airways plane escaped unhurt after the airplane suffered a tyre burst ​while landing at Bengaluru airport on Tuesday. The ground staff informed the flight's pilot about the faulty tyre, following which, he manoeuvred the plane into a safe landing. Subsequently, the scheduled departure of the flight from Bengaluru to Bangkok on Wednesday was cancelled.

111.title: Don't feel for me: Parag on entrepreneur's 'I feel for Twitter CEO' tweet
111.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal responded to an entrepreneur who had tweeted, "I feel for the current CEO of Twitter - he had all these plans and now lives with the same uncertainty of his whole team." Responding to entrepreneur Suhail Doshi, Agrawal tweeted, "Thank you but don't feel for me...What matters most is the service and the people improving it."

112.title: 7 IndiGo pilots found abusing over low salary on emergency frequency: Report
112.article_body: At least seven IndiGo pilots were allegedly found using offensive language on a frequency used for emergency communications, PTI reported. On April 9, these pilots were allegedly found using abusive language over low salaries on 121.5 MHz frequency, which is used for emergency communications only for the aircraft in distress. The DGCA has reportedly launched a probe in the matter.

113.title: 26 series were being shot when I was in Bhopal, no actor is out of work: Nawaz
113.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that the quality of web series is even worse than that of television serials but no actor is out of work these days. He said that everyone is busy and that it is a good thing. "I remember that I was shooting in Bhopal and 26 series were being shot there simultaneously," he added.

114.title: US President Joe Biden to visit South Korea, Japan in May
114.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Wednesday said President Joe Biden will travel to South Korea and Japan next month over China's growing influence in the region and new threats from nuclear-armed North Korea. Biden will separately meet with South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol and Japanese Prime Minister Kishida Fumio during his trip from May 20 to 24.

115.title: MP Mahua criticises Decathlon, says 'store insists I give my number to buy pants for dad'
115.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra complained about Decathlon store in Delhi and tweeted, "Want to buy my dad trousers for ₹1499 in CASH at Decathlon India...& manager insists I need to put in my mobile number & email ID to purchase." Stating that Decathlon is violating privacy and consumer laws, Moitra tweeted, "The sweet manager finally put in his number."

116.title: North Delhi Municipal Corporation fined ₹50 lakh over Bhalswa landfill fire
116.article_body: Delhi government on Thursday imposed a fine of ₹50 lakh on North Delhi Municipal Corporation in connection with the fire that broke out at Bhalswa landfill site. Notably, some areas of the landfill are still burning on Thursday and fire tenders are present at the site. A massive fire broke out at the Bhalswa landfill on Tuesday evening.

117.title: Endangered male tiger put to sleep due to chronic back issue in UK
117.article_body: An endangered male tiger, named Vladimir, was put to sleep after a "chronic back problem suddenly worsened" at the Yorkshire Wildlife Park in the UK. The park said the "sad decision" was made by vets on Tuesday and that he would be "dearly missed". He was one of three Amur Tigers who arrived at the park 10 years ago.

118.title: Ace your preparation strategy with your trusted partner : Pearson
118.article_body: Whether aiming for higher studies or better jobs in the future, Indian learners today demand a world-class learning experience that accelerates their career pathways, said Pearson. Aligning to the idea, the brand has launched a new brand film on 'Preparation' featuring Vicky Kaushal. The film talks about how experts like Pearson can make the preparation process convenient and accessible.

119.title: Russian fleet in Black Sea still has ability to strike Ukraine: UK
119.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Thursday said Russia's fleet in the Black Sea still has the ability to strike Ukraine despite losing its landing ship Saratov and cruiser Moskva. The ministry said around 20 Russian Navy ships, including submarines, are currently in the operational zone of the Black Sea. It added that the Bosphorus Strait remains closed to non-Turkish warships.

120.title: PMPML to increase EV charging stations as more e-buses join fleet
120.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is set to increase number of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations as more e-buses join its fleet. The EV charging station at Wagholi will have 35 charging points that can charge up to 70 e-buses simultaneously, PMPML chairman said. PMC is also likely to set up charging stations at Pune station and Bibwewadi depots.

121.title: India-Japan ties have deepened in every sphere in 70 years: PM Modi
121.article_body: On the 70th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between India and Japan, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said that the ties between the two countries have deepened in every sphere. The recent visit to India by Japanese PM Fumio Kishida laid out a roadmap for deepening the Special Strategic and Global Partnership in a post-COVID-19 world.

122.title: Nawazuddin Siddiqui, 4 family members get clean chit in minor's molestation case
122.article_body: A special POCSO (Protection of Children from Sexual Offences) court in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar has given a clean chit to actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui and four of his family members in a molestation case. According to the prosecution, Siddiqui's brother Minazuddin had allegedly molested a minor family member in 2012, while the other family members had supported him.

123.title: Switzerland implements new EU sanctions against Russia, Belarus
123.article_body: The Swiss government on Wednesday said it has implemented new EU sanctions against Russia and Belarus. The sanctions include an import ban on coal, timber, caviar and seafood which are seen as important sources of revenue for Russia. Exports of banknotes and sales of securities in all EU currencies to Belarusian nationals and residents is also banned.

124.title: I can dream of becoming UP CM again or PM but not country's President: Mayawati
124.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said SP is responsible for BJP's win in UP in the recent Assembly polls. "I can dream of becoming UP CM again or the PM but not the President of the country," Mayawati added. "SP is dreaming of making me country's President so that their path to the UP CM post is clear," Mayawati stated.

125.title: Waste pickers assaulted for dancing in religious procession in Pune
125.article_body: Two waste pickers were allegedly assaulted for dancing in a public religious procession (jatra) in Pune's Jejuri. The victims alleged that casteist remarks were made against them for dancing with the other public from the village. Following their complaint, police have launched an investigation and have booked two men under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

126.title: Video of Johnny Depp drawing during his defamation trial goes viral
126.article_body: A video of Johnny Depp doodling during his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard has gone viral on social media. In the video, Depp can be seen drawing a picture on a notepad while LAPD officer Tyler Hadden testified in court over the incident that took place in May 2016. Later, Depp was seen showing his doodle to his attorney.

127.title: Music should be heard rather than be seen: Aamir on releasing 'Kahani' on radio
127.article_body: Aamir Khan unveiled a song titled 'Kahani' from his upcoming film, 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. Aamir said he released the song on a radio station because a song deserves to be heard than just be seen with the help of visuals. Speaking about the song, he said, "I...believe that the songs in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' are the soul of the film."

128.title: Germany top buyer of Russian energy since invasion began: Study
128.article_body: A study published by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air (CREA) shows that Germany has been the top buyer of Russian energy since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. The CREA said Russia has earned €63 billion from fossil fuel exports of which Germany has paid about €9.1 billion since February 24.

129.title: Especially inappropriate: Kasparov on Djokovic supporting Russian players
129.article_body: Reacting to world number one men's tennis player Novak Djokovic's support for Russian players, ex-Russian chess grandmaster Garry Kasparov tweeted, "Russian athletes who don't condemn Putin...are supporting [him]. A [Serbian] failing to do so is especially inappropriate." "I personally believe there is no need to suspend Russian players. Competing is their right," Djokovic had earlier said.

130.title: Reels hard to monetise despite being popular: Zuckerberg
130.article_body: Reels account for over 20% of the time that users spend on Instagram, but they're hard to monetise for now, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said during the company's Q1 2022 earnings call. He added that currently AI recommendations are driving more of user feeds than social content. This will unlock "interesting" content that users would've otherwise missed, he noted.

131.title: We're all going to die some day, nuclear strike more probable: Russian TV host
131.article_body: Amid war with Ukraine, Russian state TV host Margarita Simonyan has said that everything will end with a nuclear strike, adding, "To me, it's more probable than the other outcome." "We will go to heaven, while they (enemies) will simply croak...We're all going to die someday," she said. Simonyan further said that she thinks World War-III is more realistic.

132.title: 'Sooryavansham' appeals to people, they show it again and again: Abhishek
132.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said there is something about his father and actor Amitabh Bachchan's movie 'Sooryavansham' that appeals to people. "Sooryavansham is one of the most successful films for the channel when it comes on satellite. They keep showing it again and again," he said, adding, "I think 20-21 years since its release, and it still comes on satellite television."

133.title: DC can send Shardul Thakur up the order: Virender Sehwag
133.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said he's concerned about DC's batting in IPL 2022. He added that Shaw and Warner need to play longer innings for DC to have the advantage. He further said, "You can send Shardul Thakur up the order. He hasn't been doing much with the ball...could maybe come up with useful contributions with the bat."

134.title: Police arrest 8 people for school teacher's murder in Bihar's Buxar
134.article_body: Bihar Police on Thursday arrested eight people in connection with the murder of a school teacher in Buxar. Saroj Singh, who was the main witness to his brother Chitranjan's murder, was killed on April 19. Saroj had reportedly refused to turn hostile in his brother's murder trial, following which two people were hired on contract to kill him, police said.

135.title: PM Modi lays foundation stones for healthcare, education projects in Assam
135.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid foundation stones for healthcare and education projects including a Veterinary College in Assam's Diphu, Degree College in West Karbi Anglong and Agricultural College in Kolonga on Thursday. He also addressed the public at the 'Peace, Unity and Development Rally' in Diphu and said, "Since 2014...difficulties in the North East are reducing, people are developing."

136.title: Global chipmakers evaluating sites in India for new plants: Govt
136.article_body: Some of the world's biggest chipmakers are evaluating locations in India for new plants, Communications, Electronics and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told Bloomberg Television. India is in discussion with some of the world's largest firms to attract them into the country. "India is right there squarely on their global plans whether it is Intel, GlobalFoundries," he added.

137.title: Lookout notice issued against Vijay Babu in rape case, suspected to be out of the country
137.article_body: Kerala Police has issued a lookout circular against Malayalam actor-producer Vijay Babu who's facing a rape case. Babu went into hiding after the police registered a case against him based on the complaint of a woman who had accused him of sexually abusing her several times in the last one and half months. Police suspect he's out of the country.

138.title: 2 more arrested in connection with Delhi's Jahangirpuri violence
138.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested two more persons in connection with the Jahangirpuri violence that took place on April 16. Police said that while scanning CCTV cameras and mobile videos, they found one accused roaming around with the crowd with a sword during the violence. The other accused was found to be instigating the crowd during the violence, police added.

139.title: Facing my first shot: Jaya Prada on throwback picture from her 1st movie
139.article_body: Actress Jaya Prada took to Instagram to share a throwback picture. "Throwback pic...Me facing my first shot in my movie," she captioned the picture. Her fans took to the comments section to say that she looks beautiful. "Too gorgeous ma'am," one fan commented while the other said, "Pic is not clear but you are clear."

140.title: J&K Police disallows Ramadan's last Friday prayers at Jamia Masjid suspecting protest
140.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government has decided not to allow last Friday prayers of Ramadan at Srinagar's Jamia Masjid this year, citing difficulty in managing huge congregation. "Traditionally, it is a huge congregation and it can easily spiral into an Azadi protest," a police officer said. On April 9, 'Azadi' slogans were raised inside the mosque after the Friday prayers.

141.title: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde abused online after Musk's tweets target her
141.article_body: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde is being targeted with abusive tweets after Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, criticised a content decision of Twitter's legal team. On a user's tweet about Gadde, Musk criticised Twitter's 2020 decision to block a story about Hunter Biden. Musk also tweeted a meme about Twitter's alleged "left-wing bias", which featured Gadde.

142.title: Orange warning issued for 5 states/UTs as temperatures cross 45°C; list released
142.article_body: IMD scientist RK Jenamani on Thursday said that some parts of country recorded temperatures above 45°C yesterday, adding, "In view of this, we've announced an orange warning for Rajasthan, Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha." IMD has warned about heatwave conditions over northwest and central India during the next five days and over east India during next three days.

143.title: DC players to wear special jersey against KKR tonight, share pics
143.article_body: The players of Delhi Capitals (DC) will wear a special jersey tonight in their IPL 2022 match against KKR. The special match shirts worn during the match will be auctioned off by the franchise. Every bid placed by a fan for the special match shirts will help raise funds for the Inspire Institute of Sport (IIS) Vijayanagar.

144.title: Wanted to start lingerie business 15 yrs ago, plan never saw light of day: Vineeta
144.article_body: Shark Tank India judge and SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh wrote on LinkedIn that she wanted to start a lingerie business 15 years ago. She said, "That business plan never saw the light of day." She also wrote, "It's tough to build something. It's just a little bit tougher if you're building for women, with women as a woman."

145.title: Efforts on to remove entire northeast from AFSPA's ambit: PM Modi
145.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said the Centre is working to ensure that the entire northeast region is removed from the ambit of the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA). He said Meghalaya and Tripura were removed from AFSPA's ambit because there has been a 75% drop in violent incidents in the region in the last eight years.

146.title: SC to hold final hearing on pleas challenging sedition on May 5
146.article_body: The Supreme Court will hold the final hearing on pleas challenging constitutional validity of the sedition law under IPC Section 124A on May 5, a bench led by CJI N V Ramana said. The bench asked the Centre to submit its response by the end of the week, after which the petitioners will be allowed to file their counter.

147.title: UK minister accused of watching porn on mobile phone in parliament, probe on
147.article_body: A UK minister has been accused of watching porn on mobile phone while sitting alongside a female member in the country's parliament. The Conservative Party's chief whip has ordered an investigation into the allegations against the minister. The UK government's safeguarding minister Rachel Maclean said that she wants to see the minister "out of parliament and out of the party".

148.title: I'll do it one day: Umran on bowling 155 kmph delivery in IPL 2022
148.article_body: On being asked if he's targeting to hit 155 kmph with the ball in the ongoing IPL season, SRH pacer Umran Malik said, "God willing if I've to bowl 155, I'll do it one day." Umran, however, also added that he's only looking to bowl well in the tournament. The 22-year-old has picked 15 wickets in eight games so far.

149.title: Man throws acid on woman for rejecting marriage proposal in Bengaluru
149.article_body: A 27-year-old man in Bengaluru allegedly threw acid on a 24-year-old woman for rejecting his marriage proposal. The incident happened at the staircase of the victim's office building in Sunkadakatte on Thursday. The woman has reportedly sustained more than 25% burn injuries and is being treated at a hospital. Police have launched a manhunt to arrest the accused, Nagesh.

150.title: 2 crushed to death, 3 injured as cars collide on Pune-Solapur highway
150.article_body: Two persons died and three others were injured after two cars collided with each other near the Kavadi Pat toll plaza on the Pune-Solapur highway on Thursday, police said. The impact of the collision was so severe that both cars were badly damaged and people inside them were crushed, police added. Meanwhile, an investigation has been launched into the incident.

151.title: Furniture startup WoodenStreet raises ₹230 cr at ₹1,200 cr valuation
151.article_body: Online furniture and home decor platform WoodenStreet has raised ₹230 crore ($30 million) at a valuation of ₹1,200 crore, the Jaipur-based D2C company announced on Wednesday. The Series B funding round was led by WestBridge Capital. The company closed Series A funding of $3 million from IAN and Rajasthan Venture Capital Funds in 2020.

152.title: I had conspiracy theories: Hiddink on Chelsea's 2nd leg vs Barcelona in 2009
152.article_body: Discussing the second leg of Chelsea's Champions League semi-final against Barcelona in 2009, Guus Hiddink who was then Chelsea's interim manager said, "Some people argued it was fixed. I started to have a few conspiracy theories." Chelsea were knocked out of the Champions League on the basis of the away goals rule, after it ended 1-1 on aggregate.

153.title: 62 terrorists killed in encounters so far this year: IGP Kashmir
153.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Thursday said 62 terrorists have been killed in encounters so far this year. Out of these, 47 were local terrorists and 15 were foreign terrorists, said Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Kashmir, Vijay Kumar. While 39 of the total terrorists killed belonged to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), 15 were from Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM), he added.

154.title: Putin vows 'lightning-fast' response to any foreign interference in Ukraine
154.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned if any country interferes in the ongoing Ukraine conflict it'd be met with a "lightning-fast" military response from Moscow. "We have all the tools for this, things no one else can boast of having now. And we will not boast, we will use them if necessary. And I want everyone to know that," Putin said.

155.title: 91-year-old Odissi dancer evicted, Padma Shri citation seen lying on road in Delhi
155.article_body: Centre has started evicting artistes who were allotted bungalows on rent in Delhi's Asiad village in 1980s. On Tuesday, 91-year-old Odissi dancer Guru Mayadhar Raut was evicted and his Padma Shri citation was seen lying on road. His daughter Madhumita said, "I'm extremely hurt and broken today...He doesn't deserve to be thrown out like this. Every citizen deserves basic dignity."

156.title: Around 5,000 active cases in Delhi but severity going down: Satyendar Jain
156.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday said though the number of COVID-19 cases in the capital is increasing, its severity is going down. "There are around 5,000 active COVID cases in Delhi, but hospital admissions are very few, as the entire population of Delhi is vaccinated," he said. "We have 10,000 beds...If needed, we'll increase the number," he added.

157.title: Unfortunately in Maha, we don't have any 'yogis' but 'bhogis': Raj Thackeray
157.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray congratulated UP CM Yogi Adityanath for removing thousands of loudspeakers from religious places, "especially the masjids" in the state. "Unfortunately in Maharashtra, we don't have any 'yogis'; what we have are 'bhogis'. Here's hoping and praying good sense prevails," Thackeray said. UP government removed 10,900 "illegal" loudspeakers from religious places till Wednesday.

158.title: Ugly display of faith to harass others won’t be tolerated: UP CM Yogi
158.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said it won’t be tolerated if people indulge in an "ugly display" of their faith to harass others. "There is full respect for all the faiths, there is no interference by the state government in religious practices but common people shouldn't be harassed," he added. "We proved that UP can remain free of riots," he stated.

159.title: She hit me with metal rod: Rob Kardashian on 'toxic' relationship with Blac Chyna
159.article_body: Speaking about his relationship with ex-fiancée Blac Chyna, television personality Rob Kardashian said, "It wasn't...real...love or we'd have been married. I didn't want to be married to someone like that. It was a toxic relationship." Kardashian also revealed the alleged abuse where Chyna got violent and hit him with a six-foot metal rod and pointed an unloaded gun at him.

160.title: Hair Care Juice reduces hair fall on 93% of our users in 6 weeks: Kapiva
160.article_body: According to a study conducted among Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda's consumers, 93% claim they experienced less hair fall after using Hair Care Juice. The combination of Noni, Bhringraj, Ashwagandha & Amla stimulates scalp's bloodstream, replaces dead cells in hair follicles, and combats breakage & hair loss due to stress, Kapiva stated. Furthermore, 70% users experienced faster & newer hair growth.

161.title: Most pleasing thing about Umran is that he wants to learn, improve: Moody
161.article_body: Praising their pacer Umran Malik, SRH head coach Tom Moody said the most pleasing thing about the 22-year-old is that he wants to "learn and improve". Moody added, "Umran is still very new to this high-pressure cricket. I'm sure he'll gain more and more confidence in IPL." Umran picked a five-wicket haul against GT on Wednesday.

162.title: Hardik Patel not holding talks with us despite invitation: Gujarat Cong chief
162.article_body: Gujarat Congress chief Jagdish Thakor criticised Hardik Patel by saying that he is giving anti-party statements in the media and not making himself available to resolve the differences when invited for talks with party members. "I called him last week and again yesterday. Last time he said he was busy...Later, he said he was in Surat," Thakor said.

163.title: Karachi University suicide bomber's husband arrested
163.article_body: Security officials have arrested the husband of the 30-year-old woman who blew herself up at the University of Karachi in Pakistan on Tuesday. This is reportedly the first arrest in connection with the blast case. Four people, including three Chinese nationals, were killed and several others were injured in the blast claimed by the Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA).

164.title: A regional language is the most important: Karnataka CM on national language debate
164.article_body: Referring to Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep's argument over national language debate, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "What Sudeep said was correct...A regional language is the most important as a state is formed on linguistic bases." He added, "Everyone should understand and respect what Sudeep...said." Referring to KGF: Chapter 2's success, Sudeep said Hindi is "no more" a national language.

165.title: Sickening to see the violence against Muslims celebrated in India: Padma Lakshmi
165.article_body: Indian-American model and author Padma Lakshmi has tweeted, "Sickening to see violence against Muslims celebrated in India. The widespread anti-Muslim rhetoric...poisons people." "Fellow Hindus, don't succumb to this fear-mongering. There is no threat to Hinduism in India or anywhere else. People of all faiths should be able to live peacefully together in this ancient...land.," she wrote.

166.title: Teachers told my parents there's something wrong with me: Zerodha CEO
166.article_body: Zerodha's Billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath in an interview discussed his school days and said his teachers called his parents several times and told them that "there is something wrong with your son". Talking about taking up entrepreneurship Kamath said, "It was accidental." He added he quit his job at a call centre and started portfolio management.

167.title: CCI conducts raids against Amazon's 2 Indian sellers: Report
167.article_body: The Competition Commission of India has launched raids against two domestic Amazon sellers, Cloudtail and Appario, over alleged violation of competition laws, Reuters reported citing sources. The raids, being carried out in New Delhi and Bengaluru, are related to CCI's investigation ordered in January 2020. Earlier, Amazon had been accused of promoting preferred sellers on websites.

168.title: Haryana Police constable dies after accidentally firing his service rifle
168.article_body: A constable of Haryana Police died after he accidentally fired his service rifle at his house on Tuesday. The deceased, identified as Pitamber, reportedly came home late after duty and brought the rifle with him. Next day, he started cleaning the rifle, when it accidentally went off. Pitamber was rushed to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

169.title: Tiger Shroff, Tara Sutaria visit temple, dargah ahead of Heropanti 2 release
169.article_body: Actors Tiger Shroff and Tara Sutaria visited Babulnath temple and Mahim dargah in Mumbai ahead of the release of their upcoming film, 'Heropanti 2'. Tara and Tiger carried a basket of flowers on their head as they entered the Mahim dargah. The duo donned ethnic attire as they sought blessings for the success of their forthcoming film 'Heropanti 2'.

170.title: 5 coal miners killed by gunmen in Afghanistan
170.article_body: Five coal miners were killed by unidentified gunmen in Afghanistan's Samangan province on Tuesday, according to media reports. The victims were said to be robbed before being shot by the attackers. The incident took place in the Kotal Regi area of the Dara-e-Sof district. All the victims were reportedly from the Hazara community.

171.title: Govt asks electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches due to fire incidents: Reports
171.article_body: The government has asked electric two-wheeler manufacturers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated, reports said. The government has also cautioned manufacturers who did not have incidents to take corrective measures, reports added. The makers have also been asked to recall EVs from the particular batch of vehicles that the fires were reported on recently, reports stated.

172.title: Amazon permanently lifts ban on mobile phones in warehouses: Report
172.article_body: Amazon has permanently lifted the ban on mobile phones in warehouses allowing workers to keep mobile phones with them on the job, Bloomberg reported citing an internal email. "We recognise the desire for employees to keep their mobile phones...and...last two years have demonstrated that we can safely do so," it said. The new policy will be applicable worldwide.

173.title: Maha govt collected ₹79,412 cr as fuel taxes since 2018: Hardeep Puri
173.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri took to Twitter to question the Maharashtra government's decision to not reduce Value Added Tax (VAT) on fuel. "Maharashtra...collected ₹79,412 crore...fuel taxes since 2018 and is expected to collect ₹33,000 crore this year," he stated. "Why did it not reduce VAT on petrol...diesel to provide relief to people?" he added.

174.title: Coercive, not co-operative: Rahul on PM's fuel tax appeal to states
