174.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said 68% of all fuel taxes is taken by the Centre, yet, PM Narendra Modi abdicates the responsibility. "High fuel prices - blame states, coal shortage - blame states, oxygen shortage - blame states...(PM) Modi’s federalism isn't cooperative. It’s coercive," Gandhi tweeted. His remark comes after PM Modi urged several states to cut VAT on fuel.

175.title: Maha Police seizes 89 swords from vehicle on Mumbai-Agra highway, 4 held
175.article_body: Maharashtra Police on Thursday seized 89 swords and one dagger from a Scorpio vehicle, on its way from Chittorgarh in Rajasthan, on the Mumbai-Agra highway in Dhule and arrested four men. There is no clarity on where the weapons were headed to, police said. BJP leader Ram Kadam questioned why swords from a Congress-ruled state were being brought to Mumbai.

176.title: Machine Gun Kelly & I consume each other's blood for ritual purposes: Megan Fox
176.article_body: Actress Megan Fox, speaking to Glamour magazine, opened up about she and her fiancé, singer Machine Gun Kelly, drinking each other's blood. "I guess to drink each other's blood might mislead people or people are imagining us with goblets...It's just a few drops, but yes, we do consume each other's blood on occasion for ritual purposes only," she stated.

177.title: Pooja Hegde is social media queen, what she posts has impact: Ram Charan
177.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said that actress Pooja Hegde is a social media queen and is good at it. "'Arabic Kuthu' was all over the place. We were shooting and...were waiting for next shot to set up and...I saw boys and girls...listening to 'Arabic Kuthu' and 'Butta Bomma'. It's coming out...in my Reels also...whatever Pooja posts makes an impact," he added.

178.title: Cong mute spectator to crimes against women in Rajasthan: Anurag Thakur
178.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday criticised Congress over 'rise in crime' against women in Rajasthan. "In Hathras, the way Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi came forward and Sonia Gandhi made incessant statements...Why have Sonia ji, Rahul ji and Priyanka ji turned mute spectators now?" Thakur asked. He also accused Congress of creating tensions among different communities in Rajasthan.

179.title: UN to send team to evacuate civilians from Mariupol steel plant
179.article_body: The United Nations said that it is sending an experienced team from the world over, in partnership with International Committee of the Red Cross, to evacuate people trapped in a steel plant in Ukraine's Mariupol. About 2,000 troops and 1,000 civilians are said to be trapped in bunkers below the damaged structure.

180.title: Mohali woman with blindfold after surgery loses purse to unidentified man
180.article_body: An unidentified man took away a woman’s purse while she was waiting in her daughter’s car, blindfolded after undergoing an eye operation at Mohali’s Sohana Hospital on Wednesday. The purse contained an iPhone, Apple Watch, ₹6,000, a pair of gold earrings and bangles, besides her PAN card, Aadhaar card, bank passbook and credit card, the victim’s daughter said.

181.title: Musk says Twitter needs to be politically neutral for public trust, explains what he means
181.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who recently announced that he would buy Twitter, has said, "For Twitter to deserve public trust, it must be politically neutral." He further explained that it effectively means "upsetting the far right and the far left equally". Earlier, Musk said that former US President Donald Trump's Truth Social exists because Twitter censored free speech.

182.title: Your ignorance is baffling: Ramya on Devgn's 'Hindi is national language' remark
182.article_body: Reacting to actor Ajay Devgn's 'Hindi was, is and will always be our national language' remark, actress-politician Divya Spandana, who is known as Ramya, tweeted, "No, Hindi is not our national language." She added, "Your ignorance is baffling. And it's great that films like KGF, Pushpa and RRR have done so well in Hindi belt...art has no language barrier."

183.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' becomes third-highest grossing film in Hindi
183.article_body: 'KGF: Chapter 2' has become the third-highest grossing film in Hindi with a collection of ₹343 crore. It has beaten lifetime figures of Salman Khan's 'Tiger Zinda Hai' ( ₹339.16 crore), Aamir Khan's 'PK' (₹340.8 crore) and Ranbir Kapoor's 'Sanju' (₹342.53 crore). 'KGF: Chapter 2', which's originally made in Kannada, is inching towards the ₹1,000-crore mark at overall box office.

184.title: I once got angry at Pep Guardiola, we yelled in each other's faces: Aguero
184.article_body: Ex-Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero said he once got angry at Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola during a match against Tottenham Hotspur, with the two "yelling" in each other's faces. Discussing Guardiola's reaction after Riyad Mahrez missed a chance in the first leg of Manchester City's Champions League semi-final, Aguero stated he "doesn't like" Guardiola getting angry like that.

185.title: Elon Musk wins $13 bn suit over $2.6 bn Tesla-SolarCity deal
185.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has won a $13 billion lawsuit over Tesla's $2.6 billion acquisition of SolarCity, which Tesla shareholders had called a "bailout". They accused Musk of coercing Tesla's board into buying the struggling SolarCity, to rescue his investment. However, the US court found that Musk "was more involved in the process than a conflicted fiduciary should be".

186.title: BHU students burn VC's effigy in protest against Iftar party
186.article_body: In protest against the Iftar party organised by the Vice-Chancellor of Banaras Hindu University (BHU) on the campus, a group of students from the university burnt his effigy outside his residence on Wednesday. "VC is trying to impose a new tradition. This has never happened before in the university. He is trying to politicise the entire situation," a student said.

187.title: No load-shedding since a week in Maharashtra: MSEDCL chairman
187.article_body: Maharashtra has seen zero load-shedding for the last seven days, Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) chairman Vijay Singhal said. "We were able to meet the highest demand of 25,150 MW," he added. "We could generate additional hydro-power from the Koyna dam...has a capacity of around 100 TMC (thousand million cubic feet) for hydro-power generation," Singhal stated.

188.title: Need to prepare for 'short, swift wars': Indian Air Force chief
188.article_body: The current geopolitical situation necessitates Indian Air Force to prepare for intense and small duration operations at a short notice, Chief of Air Staff Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari has said. In an address at a seminar, he also said there would be a need for the force to prepare for "short, swift wars" and be ready for "long-drawn standoff".

189.title: Tomatoes thrown at French President Macron during 1st appearance after re-election
189.article_body: Tomatoes were thrown at French President Emmanuel Macron during his first appearance in public since his re-election on Sunday. Macron was greeting people following his victory when someone from the crowd hurled tomatoes at him. The tomatoes, however, missed the French President and hit one of his security guards, who shouted "projectile".

190.title: My 1st marriage may not have worked but I haven't become anti-men: Kanika
190.article_body: Speaking about her first marriage and how she has dealt with her divorce, singer Kanika Kapoor said that she decided to go out and work after her separation. When asked about her relationship with her ex-husband, Raj Chandok, Kanika said they're cordial with each other. "My first marriage may not have worked...but I've not become anti-love or anti-men," she added.

191.title: TMC has no future in Goa: Party's state chief resigns
191.article_body: Blaming poll strategist Prashant Kishor for the upset in Assembly elections, Goa TMC chief Kiran Kandolkar on Wednesday resigned from the party. The party has no future in Goa, he said. He added he had nothing against party chief Mamata Banerjee. "Prashant Kishor is the one who leads I-PAC. If anyone has failed, it is him," said Kandolkar.

192.title: PM called meet for COVID, taunted CMs of non-BJP states on fuel price: Raut
192.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut criticised PM Narendra Modi's appeal to CMs of non-BJP ruling states to reduce VAT on fuel and said PM Modi "taunted" the CMs. "The CMs were told that PM Modi would hold a meeting on COVID...(He) was not expected to do so but CM Uddhav Thackeray and Mamata Banerjee have given the answer," Raut added.

193.title: It's sent shiver down B'wood filmmakers' spine: Manoj on South films' success
193.article_body: Discussing the success of South films, actor Manoj Bajpayee said, "It has sent a shiver down the spine of all the mainstream filmmakers from the Mumbai film industry. They...don't know where to look." "This is a lesson for Mumbai industry's mainstream filmmakers on how to make mainstream cinema," added Manoj. "They don't dumb [their films]...down for the audience," stated Manoj.

194.title: It's happening so often that I fear we'll run out of luck in knockouts: Hardik
194.article_body: After their last-ball win against SRH, GT captain Hardik Pandya jokingly said "God is helping" them out in the ongoing IPL season. "I keep joking in the dressing room that God is telling us 'You guys are good, I'll help you'. It's happening so often that I fear we may run out of luck in the knockout games," he stated.

195.title: Man sleeping on roadside killed after being run over by SUV in Pune
195.article_body: A 37-year-old SUV driver has been arrested for allegedly running over and killing an elderly man sleeping on the roadside near Pune's Salisbury Park on April 20. The police arrested the accused, Anup Mehta, on Tuesday after going through CCTV camera footage. The driver told police that he wasn't able to see the man due to the vehicle's big bonnet.

196.title: People in Srinagar gather on streets to protest power crisis
196.article_body: Locals in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar gathered on the streets to protest the ongoing power crisis on Wednesday. They claimed they don't get electricity for three to four hours a day which has impacted the businessmen and industrial unitholders. "This is the first time we are witnessing such a scenario in Kashmir," said Tariq Mughloo, Vice-President, Kashmir Economic Alliance.

197.title: Army jawans booked after 3 J&K policemen get injured over dispute
197.article_body: Indian Army jawans were booked after three policemen were reportedly injured over a dispute related to some construction work in Jammu. The Army is said to have objected to the construction by a civilian family, who claimed to have permission for renovation work from the authorities. The policemen sustained injuries when they intervened. The Army denied the assault charge.

198.title: OnePlus 10R 5G, Nord CE 2 Lite 5G and Nord Buds set to be launched today
198.article_body: OnePlus presents 'More Power to You', unveiling its latest array of products across categories. The OnePlus 10R 5G will come with 150W SuperVOOC charge support and MediaTek Dimensity 8100 MA processor whereas the OnePlus Nord CE 2 Lite will feature a 64MP AI triple camera setup. The new OnePlus Nord Buds will sport 12.4 mm dynamic bass drivers.

199.title: TN reduced tax on petrol before Centre's action: State Finance Min
199.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel, Tamil Nadu's Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan said that the Tamil Nadu government had reduced VAT on petrol back in August 2021, prior to the central government's action. "That cut resulted in a relief of ₹3/litre to the citizens of the state," the minister said.

200.title: RSS is like termite, spreading poison against society: Rajasthan Congress chief
200.article_body: Rajasthan Congress chief Govind Singh Dotasra on Wednesday said that the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) is like a "hidden termite" which is hollowing the society by spreading "poison". The Congress leader added that the RSS enjoys power behind the curtain and is not participating in direct politics to skirt accountability.

201.title: Centre owes Maha ₹26,500 cr, state not responsible for fuel price hike: Thackeray
201.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said the Centre owes the state ₹26,500 crore after PM Narendra Modi stated some states did not reduce VAT on petrol and diesel despite Union government's excise duty cut. The state is not responsible for the hike in fuel prices, he added. "Maharashtra's contribution in direct taxes collection at the national level is 38.3%," Thackeray stated.

202.title: My decision to work in a film will never be based on my character's age: Mrunal
202.article_body: Mrunal Thakur, who played the role of a mother in 'Jersey', said her decision to work in a film will never be based on her character's age. "It's dependent on [whether] the script resonates with me or how challenging it would be to play [an]...older version of myself," she added. "Make-up...doesn't help elevate the performances in such cases," she said.

203.title: Canada Parliament votes Russia's invasion of Ukraine as 'genocide'
203.article_body: Canadian lawmakers on Wednesday voted unanimously to call Russia's invasion of Ukraine a 'genocide'. The members of the Canadian House of Commons said there was "ample evidence of systemic and massive war crimes against humanity" being committed by Russia. The motion said war crimes by Russia include mass atrocities, systematic instances of willful killing of Ukrainian civilians, and rape.

204.title: Musk is revealing just how unserious a person he is: Ex-Twitter exec
204.article_body: Former Twitter executive Jason Goldman in an interview discussing Elon Musk's Twitter takeover said, "The company really could use great stewardship at this point and what he's revealing is just how unserious a person he is." He also criticised Musk's plan to relax speech restrictions, saying it "reveals a very naive and unserious approach to...content moderation issues he will face".

205.title: Man kills 8-month pregnant relative in Mumbai, foetus dies inside womb
205.article_body: An eight-month pregnant woman was murdered by her husband's cousin who was staying with them since a few months in Mumbai. An official said that the woman was found dead at her home and added that the foetus also died inside her womb. The reason for killing her has not yet been ascertained. Police have arrested the accused.

206.title: 2 former Karnataka CMs reply to Ajay Devgn's 'Hindi is our national language' tweet
206.article_body: Two former Karnataka Chief Ministers Siddaramaiah and HD Kumaraswamy have responded to Ajay Devgn's tweet directed at Kannada actor Sudeep, saying Hindi is our national language. Siddaramaiah said, "Hindi was never and will never be our national language. It's the duty of every Indian to respect linguistic diversity of our country." Kumaraswamy said, "India is a garden of several languages."

207.title: Nope! we're still here: Twitter CEO Parag after user says 'I thought we were fired'
207.article_body: Responding to a user who tweeted, "I thought we were fired," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal wrote, "Nope! we're still here." Reacting to his reply, Twitter users wrote, "Hopefully, for not much longer," and "Better start looking now." Earlier, a report said Agrawal would receive $42 million if he's terminated within 12 months of a change in control at Twitter.

208.title: NCP leader Khadse's wife gets interim relief from arrest in land scam case
208.article_body: Bombay High Court on Wednesday granted interim relief from arrest till June 20 to NCP leader Eknath Khadse's wife Mandakini Khadse in connection with the 2016 Pune land scam case. "She is arraigned as an accused in the case lodged by ED in 2019," Mandakini's advocate said. Mandakini said that this is the only case against her.

209.title: Can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Bible and Quran: K'taka Education Minister BC Nagesh
209.article_body: After a Bengaluru school allegedly made Bible reading compulsory, Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said, "We can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Quran and Bible." He said, "Bible and Quran are religious texts. But Bhagavad Gita speaks about values needed to lead life." Earlier, Archbishop of Bengaluru questioned state government's plans to introduce Bhagavad Gita as the moral science syllabus.

210.title: RCB host Maxwell's wedding party, video of Kohli dancing on Pushpa song surfaces
210.article_body: RCB organised a wedding party in the bubble for newlyweds Glenn Maxwell and Vini Raman. A video of Virat Kohli dancing on Oo Antava song from movie 'Pushpa' at the wedding party has surfaced online. Anushka Sharma also shared pictures from the wedding party, writing, "I think I’ve seen and celebrated possibly every function and festival in a bubble!"

211.title: Proud of our people who are working with focus despite the noise: Twitter CEO
211.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday said, "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus...despite the noise." Earlier, Agrawal told his employees, "There are no plans for any layoffs at this point." Recently, a report claimed that Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde cried in a meeting expressing concerns over Musk's takeover.

212.title: Exotic monkeys, wallaby rescued from 2 smugglers in Assam
212.article_body: Five exotic monkeys and a wallaby were rescued from two smugglers in Assam's North Kamrup on Wednesday. The accused were allegedly taking the caged animals to Hyderabad in a vehicle. One of the smugglers has been arrested, while the other managed to flee the spot, the forest department confirmed. The monkeys are believed to have been smuggled via Myanmar.

213.title: Corbett chief sacked, 2 IFS officers suspended over illegal construction
213.article_body: Uttarakhand government removed Rahul, the director of the Corbett Tiger Reserve and suspended two Indian Forest Service officers, JS Suhag and Kishan Chand from their posts on Wednesday. The High Court, in January, had directed to take action against the officials found guilty in the case of illegal constructions and felling of trees in the reserve's Pakhro and Morghati areas.

214.title: Liverpool defeat Villarreal to take 2-0 lead in Champions League semis
214.article_body: Liverpool defeated Villarreal 2-0 in the first leg of the Champions League semi-final. Liverpool's Jordan Henderson's deflected effort, which was ruled as Pervis Estupinan's own goal, opened the scoring while Sadio Mane doubled the lead in a two-minute span early in the second half. Liverpool are attempting to reach their third Champions League final in five years.

215.title: I won't say so: Anil on whether he is 'best friends' with Ranveer, Sanjay
215.article_body: Discussing whether he is 'best friends' with actors Ranveer Singh and Sanjay Dutt, actor Anil Kapoor said, "I won't say best friends. I am not so presumptuous that I am anybody's best friend." "I think we just respect...[and] love each other," added Anil. Anil and Ranveer starred together in the film 'Dil Dhadakne Do' which also featured Anushka Sharma.

216.title: I took this job to change Twitter for the better: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal
216.article_body: After Elon Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday tweeted, "I took this job to change Twitter for the better, course correct where we need to, and strengthen the service." "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus and urgency despite the noise," he added.

217.title: Man dupes over 170 people in investment scam in Mumbai, booked
217.article_body: Mumbai police have booked a man for duping over 170 people on the pretext of an investment scam. According to an FIR, the complainant, son of Vastu consultant Biindu Khuraana, said his family had invested around ₹60 lakh in 2020. Though, they initially received good returns, months later, they stopped receiving the money following which they approached police.

218.title: 3 members of Punjab-based gang held for uprooting ATM in Kurukshetra
218.article_body: The Kurukshetra Police arrested three members of a Punjab-based gang for allegedly uprooting an ATM containing ₹18.41 lakh cash from Shahbad in Kurukshetra earlier this month. Two members of the gang are absconding. The accused uprooted the ATM with the help of an SUV and took it along on the intervening night of April 8 and 9.

219.title: Guj woman injured after husband wanting her to quit studies assaults her
219.article_body: A woman was injured in Gujarat's Rajkot after her husband, who wanted her to not pursue her further studies, assaulted her. He also stopped her from going to get her examination hall ticket. The woman reportedly pleaded with him to let her complete her second year, after which, she said she'd quit studies but the husband abused and assaulted her.

220.title: BMC completes 25% of pre-monsoon desilting work across Mumbai
220.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has completed 25% of pre-monsoon desilting work across Mumbai, senior civic officials said on Wednesday. The civic body further aims to complete about 65% of work by May 15. Moreover, BMC is also creating a website with real-time data on desilting work in order to maintain transparency between citizens and the civic body, officials said.

221.title: J&K's Mughal Road reopens after remaining closed for over 4 months
221.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Mughal Road which connects Rajouri and Poonch districts of Jammu region with Shopian district of south Kashmir reopened for vehicular traffic on Wednesday. The road remained closed for over four months due to heavy snowfall in the area. Jammu's Divisional Commissioner ordered the reopening of the road, which was cleared of snow by the Mechanical Engineering Department.

222.title: Baidu, Pony.ai get 1st permits to deploy driverless robotaxis in China
222.article_body: Baidu and Pony.ai have received permits from Beijing city authorities to deploy their robotaxis without a safety driver, marking the first time such permits have been given in China. Both the firms are allowed to offer rides to the general public on open roads within a 60 square kilometre area in the Beijing Economic and Technological Development Area.

223.title: Delhi govt to develop 'world-class' factory complex at Jhandewalan
223.article_body: Delhi government is planning to develop a 'world-class' factory complex at Jhandewalan, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Wednesday. "Development of conforming areas such as Jhandewalan will help the government generate employment opportunities by promoting labour intensive  manufacturing and service industrial activities," Sisodia said. The plan is a part of schemes announced under Rozgar Budget.

224.title: US & Russia swap prisoners amid Ukraine war tensions
224.article_body: The US and Russia on Wednesday swapped prisoners amid their most tense relations in decades over the Ukraine war. Ex-US Marine Trevor Reed, held in Russia since 2019, was exchanged for Russian pilot Konstantin Yaroshenko, who'd been serving a 20-year sentence for conspiring to smuggle cocaine into the US. Reed was jailed for assaulting two Russian police officers in Moscow.

225.title: Had a hole in my heart, blood clot travelled from that hole to my brain: Hailey
225.article_body: While talking about her hospitalisation in March, Hailey Bieber said that she experienced stroke-like symptoms from a "blood clot that traveled from a hole in her heart to her brain". Bieber added that tests revealed that she had a mini-stroke. She underwent a procedure to close the hole, which she says was between 12 and 13 millimetres.

226.title: 3 dead, 6 injured in Unnao after car overturns on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
226.article_body: At least three members of a family, including a six-month-old girl, were killed and six others were injured after a car overturned and was hit by another vehicle on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway, police said. The car was going to Gonda from Rajasthan and it jumped to the other lane and overturned before being hit by another car, police added.

227.title: UP has set an example by removing unnecessary loudspeakers: CM Yogi
227.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said the state has set an example before the country by removing unnecessary loudspeakers installed at religious sites or reducing their volumes across UP with harmony. "Instructions given for the use of loudspeakers should be implemented strictly. The people should not face inconvenience and loudspeakers should not be installed at new sites," CM Yogi added.

228.title: Umran Malik hurricane is blowing away everything in its way: P Chidambaram on SRH pacer
228.article_body: After SRH pacer Umran Malik's five-wicket haul against GT, Congress leader P Chidambaram tweeted, "The Umran Malik hurricane is blowing away everything in its way...The sheer pace and aggression is a sight to behold." Adding that Umran is the find of IPL 2022, Chidambaram suggested BCCI should give him an exclusive coach and "quickly" induct him into the national team.

229.title: I'm not in favour of Umran being included in India's T20 WC squad: RP Singh
229.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said he's not in favour of SRH pacer Umran Malik being included in India's squad for the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Umran is surely an exciting talent...But playing him right away? I'm not in favour...because he hasn't played much domestic and even in IPL, he has only just started to do well," explained Singh.

230.title: Why should govt suffer loss of face because of your negligence?: Mamata to police
230.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the state's police force saying that their "negligence" led to incidents of violence and rape. She said, "Why should the government have a loss of face because of your negligence?" This comes after nine people were burnt alive in Birbhum and a minor girl was allegedly raped by a TMC leader's son in Nadia.

231.title: Wrote poem for Big B, got letter he wrote next day: Runway 34 actress Aakanksha
231.article_body: 'Runway 34' actress Aakanksha Singh said that getting a handwritten letter from actor Amitabh Bachchan was a "very big deal" for her. She said she wrote a poem for the actor after he sent her a buggy when she had a fracture. "He had written...You will keep getting appreciation letters. But first, please accept this letter," Aakanksha added.

232.title: Improvised scene by putting nail paint on fingers: Nawazuddin on playing Laila
232.article_body: When asked if he was apprehensive about playing a feminine guy 'Laila' in 'Heropanti 2', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that he was looking for a role that is "villainous" and "feminine" at the same time. "There's a scene where I'm putting nail polish on my fingers, it wasn't a part of the script initially, but I improvised it," he added.

233.title: Feels good, happy to deliver against SRH: Rashid Khan on 31*(11)
233.article_body: GT's Rashid Khan, who smashed unbeaten 31 runs off 11 balls on Wednesday, said he's happy to deliver against SRH. He added, "[I'm] just trying to play my game and have that belief [in] my batting which I'm working [on] for the last two years." Rashid smashed three sixes in final over to help GT chase down SRH's 195-run total.

234.title: UK govt proposes seizing crypto assets to help against economic crime
234.article_body: The UK government has proposed seizing crypto assets to help combat economic crime. It told the parliament's Treasury Select Committee that the creation of a civil forfeiture power would "mitigate the risk posed by those that cannot be prosecuted but use their funds to further criminality". The parliamentary inquiry recommended creating a single body to tackle economic crime.

235.title: Skulls found by Mexican police from AD 900, not a crime scene
235.article_body: A pile of about 150 skulls found in a Mexico cave in 2012, which the police believed to be a crime scene, turned out to be over a thousand years old. According to archaeologists, the skulls belonged to sacrificial victims killed between AD 900 and 1200. They said the victims were likely decapitated and their skulls put on display.

236.title: Expel me if you want me to join BJP: Shivpal to Akhilesh
236.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark that why was the BJP delaying induction of Shivpal Yadav, the latter said that if Akhilesh wanted him to join BJP then he should expel him from the party. "It's an irresponsible and childish statement. I'm one of 111 MLAs of SP who won in recent assembly elections," Shivpal said.

237.title: 36-yr-old property dealer held for killing 2 men in Prayagraj
237.article_body: A 36-year-old property dealer was arrested for allegedly killing two men involved in the sale and purchase of properties in Prayagraj's Dhoomanganj area on Wednesday, police said. The accused shot dead both the men after they had an argument over a property deal at the former's residence. The deceased and the accused were known to each other, police added.

238.title: UP govt removes 10,900 'illegal' loudspeakers from religious places
238.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government said it has removed 10,900 "illegal and unauthorised" loudspeakers from religious places across the state on Wednesday. "There's an existing 2018 order...there are set rules for sound decibel limits and court directions," it added. "Focus is to ensure the implementation of guidelines through dialogue, making everyone understand the norms through awareness," UP Police said.

239.title: Satyajit Ray did posters, music for films out of compulsion: Shoojit Sircar
239.article_body: Talking about late Indian filmmaker Satyajit Ray, director Shoojit Sircar said, "Ray is called a multi-talented director but this may be out of compulsion." "He [made] his own posters because probably he thought others won't realise it...the same way. Ray did music in his films as he wasn't sure...he could explain the context...in its entirety to another person," added Shoojit.

240.title: Mumbai court acquits builder, 4 police officials for planting drugs on agent
240.article_body: A special court acquitted a builder and four Mumbai Police officials, who were booked for planting drugs and a weapon on an estate agent. In 2004, 340 grams of heroin and a weapon were seized from the agent by Dongri Police. After the agent spent 150 days in jail, a probe revealed that he was falsely implicated by the accused.

241.title: 5 persons booked for attempted murder in Ludhiana after assaulting couple
241.article_body: Five persons were booked in Ludhiana for attempted murder after they assaulted a 23-year-old man and his wife with a baseball bat and a sword. The incident occurred on April 24, when the accused first assaulted the man over a verbal spat. Later, when his wife came to his rescue, the accused also assaulted her, according to the male complainant.

242.title: Astronauts launched by SpaceX reach International Space Station
242.article_body: The Crew-4 astronauts launched by SpaceX reached the International Space Station at 5:07 am IST on Thursday after a journey of nearly 16 hours. While three astronauts - Kjell Lindgren, Robert Hines, Jessica Watkins - are from NASA, the fourth - Samantha Cristoforetti is from European Space Agency. NASA said it was one of the fastest flights to the ISS.

243.title: Petrol will be cheaper if states cut taxes on fuel instead of liquor: Petroleum Minister
243.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday tweeted, "Petrol will be cheaper if opposition ruled states cut taxes on fuel instead of imported liquor!" He added, "Maharashtra govt imposes ₹32.15/ltr on petrol & Congress ruled Rajasthan ₹29.10. But BJP ruled Uttarakhand levies only ₹14.51 & Uttar Pradesh ₹16.50." He further wrote, "Protests cannot challenge facts!"

244.title: Gavaskar punched the ceiling, jumped and screamed: Pietersen on Umran taking 5 wickets
244.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said the way ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar celebrated in the commentary box after SRH pacer Umran Malik's five-wicket haul was "more exciting" than the dismissals. Pietersen added that Gavaskar punched the ceiling, jumped and screamed. "I think he did that because how often have we seen India producing the fastest bowler in world cricket?" Pietersen stated.

245.title: North stars are jealous of south stars after KGF 2's success: Ram Gopal Varma
245.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn recently took offence to Kiccha Sudeep's "Hindi is not our national language" comment. Reacting to it, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took Sudeep's side and wrote, "The base undeniable ground truth @KicchaSudeep sir, is that the north stars are insecure and jealous of the south stars because a Kannada dubbing film #KGF2 had a ₹50 crore opening day."

246.title: Got attention in childhood; people clapped & whistled, I got addicted: Yash
246.article_body: Actor Yash said that he used to participate in a lot of cultural activities in his childhood. "I used to get that extra attention...people used to clap and whistle. So I think I got addicted to it at a very young age," he added. Yash further said that he always wanted to be a hero and never had plan B.

247.title: I didn't like how villains treated my mom in films: Mandakini's son Rabbil
247.article_body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini's son Rabbil Thakur said he did not watch any of his mother's films during his childhood, as he did not like watching them. "I used to not like seeing the way villains treated my mom. I [did not]...understand the concept that this is just a movie and she is just acting," added Rabbil.

248.title: SRK throwing T-shirts not act of negligence: HC on 2017 stampede incident
248.article_body: Gujarat High Court has quashed a criminal complaint against Shah Rukh Khan, observing that the actor throwing T-shirts and smiley balls at Vadodara railway station in 2017 while promoting 'Raees' cannot be termed acts of "high degree of negligence". According to the complaint, Khan threw the items at the crowd, which resulted in a stampede and death of a person.

249.title: Pic of Rahul Dravid throwing cap in anger resurfaces after Muralitharan's outburst
249.article_body: After Muttiah Muralitharan got angry and shouted in frustration during SRH's defeat against GT, fans recalled Rahul Dravid throwing his cap in anger during IPL 2014. Dravid, who was RR's mentor at the time, threw the cap after their defeat against MI. "Only tournament in the world that can make Dravid and Muralitharan lose their calm," a fan tweeted.

250.title: US govt's religious freedom body criticises India; Hindu council calls it 'Indophobic'
250.article_body: After US Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) recommended to the US administration to designate India and 14 other nations as "country of particular concern" in the context of status of religious freedom, HinduPACT said USCIRF has been taken over by "Indophobic and Hinduphobic members". "Many of these members have attended India and Hindu bashing events," HinduPACT added.

251.title: Maha man asked to shut up after fight with wife slaps constable, held
251.article_body: Kongaon Police arrested a man for slapping constable following fight with his wife. The accused tried to break the main door after thumping on it, after which, his wife got scared. "Our constables...brought...man to the police station...he started abusing police officials...when he was asked to shut up...he slapped...a constable and pushed others who tried to stop him," an officer said.

252.title: Truck speeds away for kilometres with toll official standing on bumper in Andhra
252.article_body: A video went viral showing a truck speeding away on a highway in Andhra Pradesh with a toll official standing on its bumper. As per reports, the driver was asked to pay a fine after which he sped away. The worker was reportedly scanning FASTag by standing on the bumper. The truck was reportedly stopped by police after several kilometres.

253.title: India reports 3,303 COVID-19 cases, 39 deaths in 24 hours
253.article_body: India has reported 3,303 COVID-19 cases, 2,563 recoveries and 39 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,927 COVID-19 cases and 32 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 16,980, while the death toll rose to 5,23,693.

254.title: US judge rejects Musk's bid to end Tesla tweets review under SEC deal
254.article_body: A US judge has rejected Tesla CEO Elon Musk's bid to end the condition to have his tweets on Tesla vetted by a competent lawyer before posting, a requirement under his US SEC deal. Musk has claimed he was forced to agree to the deal. The judge said Musk's free speech argument against the deal is "meritless" and "particularly ironic".

255.title: 2 youths arrested for stealing silencers of 14 cars in Pune
255.article_body: Two youths have been arrested for stealing silencers of 14 cars and selling their parts in Pune. According to police, the duo "would extract catalytic converter from these cars and extract the crushed material that has components of expensive elements". "We are yet to nab the person to whom they sold these elements," Loni Kalbhor Police Station officials said.

256.title: Need control over Delhi as it is the face of India: Centre to SC
256.article_body: Centre told the Supreme Court that it needs to have control over administrative services in Delhi as the world views India through its national capital. "It's necessary...Centre has powers over appointments and transfers of public servants. Delhi is the face of the nation," it added. SC was hearing petitions by the Delhi government against the Centre's control of civil services.

257.title: Fire breaks out at Chennai’s Rajiv Gandhi hospital, no casualties reported
257.article_body: A massive fire broke out at Chennai's Rajiv Gandhi government hospital around 11 am on Wednesday. "This was an unexpected accident which happened due to...short circuit," Health Minister Ma Subramanian said after visiting the spot. No injuries or casualties have been reported. Earlier, four fire tenders were rushed to the spot and more joined later to douse the fire.

258.title: India not part of climate problem but will play big role in solution: Union Minister
258.article_body: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Wednesday said India is not a part of the climate problem but it wants to be and will be a big part of the solution. "To address climate change, technology transfer is necessary…India is among few G20 countries that have fulfilled its nationally determined contribution (NDC) under the Paris Agreement," Yadav stated.

259.title: Don't think Hardik Pandya will bowl a lot now in IPL 2022: Wasim Jaffer
259.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said GT captain Hardik Pandya, who hasn't bowled in his last two games, is unlikely to "bowl a lot" in their upcoming matches as the team has got all their bases covered. "GT will take care of Hardik and [he'll] only bowl if needed to...they've Lockie [Ferguson], [Mohammad] Shami, and Alzarri Joseph," explained Jaffer.

260.title: J&K Army-run school asks staff to avoid hijab; official clarifies
260.article_body: An Indian Army-run school in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla asked its staff to avoid wearing hijab during school hours. This triggered a controversy with several political leaders opposing the move. Following this, Defence spokesperson Emron Musavi clarified that the circular mistakenly mentioned hijab instead of 'niqab' [a veil which covers the entire face except for eyes].

261.title: Central Railway allows co-branding rights to stations in Mumbai division
261.article_body: The Central Railway has allowed private companies, corporates, banks and government agencies to brand their names in 83 stations, which includes almost all stations of Mumbai division to generate non-fare income. "We are in the bidding process right now. We have received interest from private companies for a few railway stations of Palghar and Dahanu," a Western Railway official said.

262.title: I'd love to work with Aishwarya, I enjoy working with her: Abhishek on wife
262.article_body: When asked if he would like to work with his wife, actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, anytime soon, actor Abhishek Bachchan said, "I'd love to collaborate with her again, but obviously, it has to be the right script at the right time." Speaking about his wife as an actor, Abhishek said that she is wonderful and he enjoys working with her.

263.title: Delhi Police busts fake arms licence racket, 4 people arrested
263.article_body: The Crime Branch of Delhi Police has busted a fake arms licence racket and arrested four persons. Based on a tip-off, police laid a trap and apprehended one person accused of carrying illegal arms. On further investigation, the other three accused were also arrested. About 15 fake arms licences, purportedly issued from Jammu and Kashmir, were recovered from the accused.

264.title: He has been bowling beautifully: Williamson on Umran's 5/25 vs GT
264.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson praised pacer Umran Malik for his performance against GT, stating that the 22-year-old is bowling beautifully in the tournament. "It was an outstanding performance [against GT]," he added. Umran picked a five-wicket haul in the game, conceding 25 runs. SRH lost the match after Rashid Khan smashed three sixes off Marco Jansen in the final over.

265.title: Karnataka reports 126 new COVID-19 cases; 114 in Bengaluru alone
265.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday reported 126 new COVID-19 cases out of which 114 were reported in Bengaluru alone. The city also recorded 92 daily coronavirus recoveries and a positivity rate of 3.06%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). Notably, with the new cases, the total number of active coronavirus cases in Bengaluru has risen to 1,648.

266.title: Guj teacher arrested for derogatory WhatsApp post against minority
266.article_body: A school teacher was arrested in Gujarat's Ahmedabad for allegedly sharing a derogatory post against a minority community on WhatsApp. The police said the accused, Manisha Bhavsar, "was part of several WhatsApp groups where she had shared and saved posts that were derogatory against the Muslim community". "After technical surveillance and investigation, the accused was arrested," added police.

267.title: Hyderabad Police busts organised gambling racket, 7 held
267.article_body: Hyderabad's Banjara Hills Police busted an organised gambling racket in Yousufguda's Sri Krishna Nagar area. Acting on credible information, police conducted a raid and arrested seven accused persons, including the (gambling) organiser. The organiser used to invite punters, who have the habit of gambling by betting money and gaining easy money illegally, Banjara Hills SHO said.

268.title: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak cleared of ethics breach over wife's non-dom status
268.article_body: UK Chancellor Rishi Sunak has been cleared by PM Boris Johnson's ethics adviser of breaching ministerial rules over his wife Akshata Murty's non-dom status and the green card granting him residency in the US. The independent adviser Christopher Geidt said Sunak had declared his interests correctly and had been "assiduous in meeting his obligations and in engaging with this investigation".

269.title: Ex-Twitter CEO tells Musk 'bullying isn't leadership', he reacts
269.article_body: Former Twitter CEO Dick Costolo reacted to Elon Musk's response to Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde reportedly crying over his takeover and expressing concerns, saying, "Bullying is not leadership...You're making an executive at the company you just bought...target of harassment." In response, Musk said, "What are talking about? I'm just saying Twitter needs to be politically neutral."

270.title: India built ties with Russia out of necessity as we couldn't do it earlier: US
270.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said, "Russia, for India, was out of necessity a partner of choice when we were not in a position to be a partner." "Now, we are investing in that effort. I think there is a growing strategic convergence between the United States and India," Blinken further said.

271.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after 40 matches?
271.article_body: Following the conclusion of 40 matches in IPL 2022, GT are on top of the points table with 14 points. RR are second on the points table with 12 points. They are followed by SRH, LSG and RCB, who have 10 points each. MI, who are yet to win a match in the tournament, are placed last on the table.

272.title: Muralitharan shouts in anger during last over of SRH-GT match, video goes viral
272.article_body: SRH's strategy and spin bowling coach Muttiah Muralitharan was seen shouting in anger when GT vice-captain Rashid Khan smashed SRH pacer Marco Jansen for a six in last over of their IPL 2022 match. Muralitharan stood up from his chair and purportedly said, "Why the f**k is he bowling full?" Jansen conceded 25 runs in the over as GT won.

273.title: Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in: Elon Musk
273.article_body: Days after he struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "Can you buy the moon for me Elon? Earth has lots of wars going on," while another tweeted, "Buy TikTok and delete it."

274.title: Farmers send mango stock to Pune due to rains, prices slashed by 25%
274.article_body: Farmers from Konkan belt have started sending mango stock to Pune Market Yard due to unexpected rains. In last week, over 10,000 boxes of Alphonso mangoes have arrived in Market Yard. Due to increase in supply, prices of these mangoes have been reduced by at least  25%. Sale of mangoes is also increasing as Akshaya Tritiya is approaching.

275.title: 2 men die after falling into sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana
275.article_body: At least two men died after falling into a sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana area on Wednesday, officials said. The men were working near the spot when the accident took place, officials added. "The firemen pulled out the men...sent them to the Maharishi Valmiki Hospital where the doctors declared them brought dead," Delhi Fire Services (DFS) chief Atul Garg said.

276.title: SRH's Umran Malik records best bowling figures of IPL 2022
276.article_body: SRH fast bowler Umran Malik on Wednesday recorded the best bowling figures of IPL 2022. The 22-year-old pacer recorded figures of 4-0-25-5 against GT, registering his first-ever five-wicket haul in T20 cricket. The previous best bowling figures of IPL 2022 (4-0-40-5) were recorded by RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal against KKR on April 18.

277.title: 2-year-old boy dies after being attacked by stray dogs in Hyderabad
277.article_body: A two-year-old boy died after being attacked by a pack of stray dogs in Hyderabad, reports stated. The boy was playing near his house when the dogs attacked and dragged him to adjoining military area on Tuesday night. Meanwhile, locals have alleged that Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) failed to act though stray dogs pose a grave threat to them.

278.title: GT smash 4 sixes in last over to beat SRH on last ball, reclaim top spot on points table
278.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) defeated SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) by five wickets to reclaim the top spot on the IPL 2022 points table. GT chased down the target of 196 on their last delivery. Needing 22 runs in the last over, GT smashed four sixes and scored 25 runs to complete the chase. Rashid Khan slammed an unbeaten 31 off 11 deliveries.

279.title: COVID-19 situation in Karnataka is under control: CM Bommai
279.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in the state is under control. He added that 2% of international passengers will be randomly tested and teletracking of passengers coming from Australia, Indonesia, New Zealand and South Korea will be carried out. Samples of hospitalised patients who are COVID-19 positive will be sent for genome sequencing, he added.

280.title: Imran Khan begged Pakistani army till last minute to save his govt: Maryam Nawaz
280.article_body: Pakistan's ousted Prime Minister Imran Khan was so desperate that he "begged" the military establishment till the last minute to save his government, Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) Vice President Maryam Nawaz has claimed. "He had even requested former President and PPP co-chairman Asif Ali Zardari to help him in the wake of a no-confidence motion against him," Maryam said.

281.title: James Murdoch's Bodhi Tree partners with Reliance to invest ₹13,500 cr in Viacom18
281.article_body: Reliance and Viacom18 have inked a partnership with Bodhi Tree to turn Viacom18 into "one of the largest TV and digital streaming companies" in India. Bodhi Tree is a platform run by James Murdoch's Lupa Systems and ex-Disney executive Uday Shankar. Reliance's JioCinema will also be transferred to Viacom18 as part of the Bodhi Tree-led ₹13,500-crore investment deal.

282.title: India in talks with Norway wealth fund, GIC over LIC IPO: Report
282.article_body: India is in talks to sign up Norway's sovereign wealth fund and Singapore's GIC Pte as anchor investors for LIC IPO, Bloomberg reported. As per its sources, Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, BlackRock Inc and Fidelity have been approached as well. The Centre is looking to finalise the anchor investor list within days, the report added.

283.title: He removed his bag to accommodate Viv's bag: Vivek Razdan on Kohli's gesture on flight
283.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Vivek Razdan recalled how Virat Kohli once removed his own bag from the overhead locker of a flight in the Caribbean to accommodate the bag of ex-West Indies captain Viv Richards, who was unable to find space. "Kohli...kept his bag below the seat ahead of him," Razdan added. "Richards tapped his shoulder and thanked him," he further said.

284.title: IAS officer booked after IRS officer wife's dowry harassment allegation in MP
284.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police have filed a case against an Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer after his wife accused him and his family members of dowry harassment. Police said that the woman is an Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer. “Based on the complaint, a case was registered against the IAS officer, his mother and sister for dowry harassment,” police said.

285.title: 'Major' to release on June 3, will clash with Akshay's 'Prithviraj'
285.article_body: Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Major' has been postponed again and now will release on June 3. Previously, the film was slated to release on May 27. However, the actor announced on Twitter that the release has been pushed by a week. The film's release date had earlier been postponed due to the pandemic. The film will now clash with Akshay Kumar's 'Prithviraj'.

286.title: Your rules won't apply here: EU to Musk over Twitter deal
286.article_body: The European Union has warned that Elon Musk-owned Twitter will have to respect the bloc's rules regarding online content moderation. "Elon, there are rules...It's not your rules which will apply here," said EU Internal Market Chief Thierry Breton. He added that if Twitter fails to comply, the EU could fine 6% of its annual revenue or even ban it entirely.

287.title: Bomb threat letter found at railway station in Punjab's Kapurthala
287.article_body: A bomb threat letter was found at Sultanpur Lodhi Railway Station in Punjab's Kapurthala on Wednesday, ANI reported. The letter mentioned that major railway stations like Sultanpur Lodhi, Ferozepur and Jalandhar will be blown up by May 21 to avenge, ANI quoted the Station Master as saying. It also reportedly mentioned that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann will also be attacked.

288.title: ₹1 lakh ex-gratia to those severely injured in Thanjavur incident
288.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin met those who were injured in the Thanjavur electrocution incident and announced ex-gratia of ₹1 lakh to those severely injured and ₹50,000 to the injured. "It is a tragic and painful incident. We have ordered officials to take action on this issue," he said. Eleven people were killed and 15 were injured in the incident.

289.title: I wish Musk the very best, our social media rules remain unchanged: MoS IT
289.article_body: Rajeev Chandrasekhar, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Electronics and Information Technology, told ET, "I wish Elon Musk the very best," as the world's richest person struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. He added that the government's goals and expectations of accountability and safety rules for all social media intermediaries, including Twitter, remain the same.

290.title: Man Utd's Rangnick accepts top-four finish in PL is not 'realistic'
290.article_body: Manchester United's interim manager Ralf Rangnick accepts that a top-four finish in the Premier League this season is not "realistic" ahead of their Premier League clash with Chelsea on Thursday. United are currently sixth on the table with 54 points with four games left. "Even if we win all four games, it's still not in our own hands," Rangnick said.

291.title: Australian minister accuses China of interference ahead of federal polls
291.article_body: Australian minister Karen Andrews on Wednesday suggested that China deliberately announced its security pact with Solomon Islands ahead of Australian federal polls in a bid to derail Liberal Party's re-election. She further claimed that China wants the Labor Party to win elections. Notably, Labor Party has claimed that Australian government's inability to stall pact is a foreign policy failure.

292.title: India has one language, which is entertainment: Sonu Sood on national language debate
292.article_body: Sonu Sood spoke about the ongoing debate on whether Hindi can be considered the national language of the country. "I don't think Hindi can be called just the national language. India has one language, which is entertainment," he said. "It doesn't really matter which industry you belong to. If you entertain people, they will love you...and accept you," Sonu added.

293.title: Danish teenager Rune beats world no. 3 Zverev in Munich
293.article_body: Danish teenager Holger Rune on Wednesday beat world number three Alexander Zverev 6-3, 6-2 at the ATP 250 tournament in Munich. "I have a lot of respect for him, and I obviously didn't expect to win in two sets, and with a score like this," the 18-year-old said. Rune's victory over Zverev is his first against a Top 10 opponent.

294.title: Opp'n hasn't reduced VAT on fuel, BJP did months before: Minister
294.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that the Opposition ruled states have not reduced taxes on fuel, despite BJP-led states having done it months before. "Opposition only looks at the Centre but does not reduce the taxes in their own states. Don't they want to benefit the people who voted them to power?" he said.

295.title: Indonesia widens export ban to include crude and refined palm oil
295.article_body: Indonesia has widened the scope of its export ban on raw materials for cooking oil to include crude and refined palm oil, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Wednesday. In a separate statement, President Joko Widodo said people's need for affordable food trumped revenue concerns. Export ban will be lifted once domestic needs are met, Widodo said.

296.title: Reliance, Apollo Global plan joint bid for UK pharma chain Boots: Report
296.article_body: Reliance Industries and US-based Apollo Global Management are planning a joint bid for UK's high street pharmacy chain Boots, the Financial Times reported. Both would own equity stakes in Boots under the plan, however, it's unclear whether the size of their stakes would be the same. Boots' US parent Walgreens Boots Alliance put the business for sale in December 2021.

297.title: Web space gave me visibility like never before: Sikandar Kher
297.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher has said the OTT platform gave him visibility that he never got before. "As an actor, you need and want people to see your work and your abilities," he stated. "When you get that many eyeballs, filmmakers also get the chance to view you in their projects and the characters they create," Sikandar further added.

298.title: We need to take more chances: Foden on CL SF clash with Real Madrid
298.article_body: Phil Foden admitted Manchester City needed to "take more chances" after their Champions League semi-final first-leg clash on Tuesday. City won 4-3 despite having a two-goal advantage on three occasions. "It was a great game. End to end. We started really well and could have killed them off. In these games, we need to take more chances," Foden said.

299.title: World no.1 Swiatek withdraws from Madrid Open with shoulder injury
299.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek has withdrawn from the Madrid Open due to a right shoulder injury. "I need a break from playing so intensively in order to treat my arm well and that's why, unfortunately, I have to withdraw," the 20-year-old said. Swiatek is on a 23-match unbeaten streak after winning her fourth consecutive title in Stuttgart on Sunday.

300.title: Finnish, Swedish security services warn of Russian interference amid NATO bid
300.article_body: Finland and Sweden must be vigilant of Russian spy operations and cyber attacks as they consider NATO membership bid, nordic countries' intelligence chiefs said on Wednesday. The announcement comes amid reports that the countries may apply to join alliance in May. Russia has warned of deploying nuclear weapons and hypersonic missiles in Baltic enclave of Kaliningrad if they join NATO.

301.title: No longer good enough to supply defensive weapons to Ukraine: Truss
301.article_body: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Tuesday said it is no longer good enough for Britain to supply only defensive weapons to Ukraine against its war with Russia. "For too long, there was a false distinction between defensive and offensive weapons. It became an excuse for some to drag their feet. That time has now passed," she said.

302.title: EU tiggers rule of law mechanism against Hungarian government
302.article_body: The EU on Wednesday launched its rule of law mechanism against the Hungarian government that could strip Hungary of its EU funding. The mechanism allows the EU to withhold funds from member states if they are found to have committed violations against the EU's democratic standards. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen criticised "corruption" in Hungary earlier this month.

303.title: Won't do too many dance numbers, it's a matter of being typecast: Regina
303.article_body: Actress Regina Cassandra, who has a dance number in 'Acharya', said she would not do too many of them in the future. "A few years ago, I was offered a song with Chiranjeevi. After that, I got many more offers to do item numbers," she stated. "Makers felt...why can't I do it in another? It's...matter of being typecast," Regina added.

304.title: Paying for Russian gas in roubles breaches sanctions: EU chief
304.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said paying for Russian gas in roubles would breach sanctions imposed on Russia. "We have about 97% of all contracts that explicitly stipulate payments in euros or dollars," she said. Unless a supply contract was denominated in roubles, European firms should not accede to Russia's demands, she added.

305.title: 1 dead, 24 missing after migrant boat capsizes off Canary Islands
305.article_body: Authorities said a boat carrying 61 migrants capsized off Spain's Canary Islands leaving one person dead and 24 missing. Spain's marine services rescued 36 people, including two minors and 10 women, and recovered the body of a woman. A spokeswoman said three boats in total were intercepted. A total of 116 people were rescued from the other two boats.

306.title: 36th Russian colonel killed in Ukraine since invasion began
306.article_body: Lieutenant Colonel Oleg Yevseev is the 36th Russian colonel to be killed in Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24. Russia did not provide details on how or when he died. Yevseev was a commander of the 291st Artillery Brigade of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation. At least 36 colonels and eight generals have died so far.

307.title: COVID-19 is now at an endemic stage, not pandemic: Mexican govt
307.article_body: The Mexican government said COVID-19 is no longer a pandemic but has passed to an endemic stage in Mexico. "It is now retreating almost completely," President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said. Mexico has recorded almost 325,000 COVID-19 related deaths since the pandemic began, although government reviews of death certificates suggest the actual death toll could be about 490,000.

308.title: GT's Lockie Ferguson bowls most expensive 20th over in IPL 2022
308.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) fast bowler Lockie Ferguson on Wednesday bowled the most expensive 20th over in an IPL 2022 match after conceding 25 runs against SRH. Ferguson was hit for four sixes in the over, out of which three were hit by Shashank Singh. Ferguson recorded bowling figures of 4-0-52-0 in the match.

309.title: 14-yr-old gets pregnant after being raped by 5 Russian soldiers, plans to keep the baby
309.article_body: A 14-year-old girl is pregnant after being raped by five Russian soldiers in Ukraine, said reports. The teenager, from Bucha, plans to keep the child after doctors warned if she had an abortion now she may not be able to have children again. Her story has been shared by psychologist Oleksandra Kvitko, who is helping her accept the child.

310.title: Ukraine still in control of majority of its airspace: UK
310.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Wednesday said Ukraine remains in control of the majority of its airspace as Russia has failed to "effectively destroy" Ukraine's air force. They said Ukraine's air defences have also not been "suppressed" by Russian forces which first invaded Ukraine on February 24. "Ukraine continues to hold Russian air assets at risk," they added.

311.title: Will take considerate view on crypto, it can't be rushed: FM
311.article_body: The government will take a considerate decision on cryptocurrency regulation but it can't be rushed through, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. However, she added that the government is open to promote innovation made in the distributed ledger technologies. "Our intention is in no way to hurt this (innovation around crypto)...but (we need to) define for ourselves," she stated.

312.title: Rashid Khan records his 3rd most expensive spell in IPL
312.article_body: GT leg-spinner Rashid Khan on Wednesday recorded his third-most expensive spell in IPL. The 23-year-old gave away 45 runs against SRH, registering figures of 4-0-45-0. Rashid was hit for three sixes and two fours in his spell. Rashid's most expensive spell in IPL had come on April 19, 2018, when he conceded 55 runs against PBKS while representing SRH.

313.title: US considers imposing sanctions against Putin's alleged girlfriend: Reports
313.article_body: The US is reportedly considering imposing sanctions against Alina Kabaeva, the woman it believes is Russian President Vladimir Putin's girlfriend and mother of at least three of his children. The WSJ claimed that earlier, the US spared Kabaeva from Russian sanctions in a "last-minute" decision. Russia's 38-year-old politician Kabaeva is a retired Olympic gold medal winner in rhythmic gymnastics.

314.title: Travis Scott to publicly perform for 1st time since Astroworld tragedy
314.article_body: Travis Scott will be performing publicly for the first time since the Astroworld tragedy that took place in November last year and killed 10 people. The rapper will be performing in Miami on May 7 at E11even during the 'Race Week' ahead of the F1 Grand Prix race. E11even's website has begun the sale for the tickets for Scott's event.

315.title: 26-yr-old woman beats 3-yr-old son to death in Raj, arrested
315.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly beating her three-and-a-half-year-old son to death in Chhipabarod town of Baran district, police said. The woman beat her son at their house bolting the room from inside, Chhipabarod Police Station SHO Ravinder Singh said. The accused was arrested after her husband, Anil Jatav, filed a police report against her.

316.title: McLaren's Ricciardo apologises to Ferrari's Sainz after 1st lap crash
316.article_body: McLaren's Daniel Ricciardo apologised to Ferrari's Carlos Sainz after causing a collision in the first lap of the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix last Sunday. Ricciardo finished the race in 18th place. "Obviously not the way I wanted Sunday to go. A painful one and obviously not the way I want to affect somebody else's race," Ricciardo said.

317.title: Destroyed 'large batch' of Western-supplied arms in Ukraine: Russia
317.article_body: Russian forces have destroyed a large quantity of foreign weapons in southeastern Ukraine with long-range missiles, the country's defence ministry said on Wednesday. According to the ministry, the destroyed weapons were supplied by the US and European countries for Ukrainian troops. This comes after the US and 40 other nations held a security summit to discuss arms supplies to Ukraine.

318.title: Russia bans 287 UK lawmakers from entering country amid Ukraine war
318.article_body: Russia on Wednesday placed sanctions on 287 lawmakers from the UK's lower house of parliament and banned them from entering the country amid the ongoing Ukraine invasion. "These persons...contribute(d) to the groundless whipping up of Russophobic hysteria in the UK," a statement from Russia's foreign ministry read. Russia's move came after the UK imposed sanctions on 386 Russian parliamentarians.

319.title: NDMA issues guidelines for COVID-19 death compensation
319.article_body: The National Disaster Management Authority on Wednesday issued guidelines for those wanting compensation for the death of a family member due to COVID-19. The guideline said that those wanting compensation will have to file the application by May 23 and all COVID-19 deaths that have occurred before March 20, 2022, are eligible to apply for compensation.

320.title: Labour Ministry calls Infosys for discussion on non-compete clause
320.article_body: The Labour Ministry issued a notice to Infosys to hold a joint discussion on April 28 regarding the enforcement of the non-compete agreement. The agreement bans ex-employees from working for same customers in rival firms for six months. This comes after Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES), an IT union, filed a complaint with the Ministry seeking the clause's removal.

321.title: I'm able to make choices in films because of my family's work: Harsh
321.article_body: Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor, speaking about his films' choices, has said, "The reason I can make the choices that I've done is because of the work...they (his family) have done." "I'm secure...Financially, emotionally...I'm able to make those choices. So, thanks to the work that the family has done for so many decades," he further added. Harsh will feature in 'Thar'.

322.title: BJP and CPI(M) are trying to defame West Bengal: Mamata Banerjee
322.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the law and order situation in West Bengal was under control and accused some sections of media of spreading misinformation. "A suicide case was turned into a rape case. BJP and CPI(M) are both trying to defame Bengal," Mamata Banerjee said. We will not let Bengal become Hathras or Unnao, she added.

323.title: Shooting of 'Scam 2003' begins, Hansal Mehta shares pic from the sets
323.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta took to Instagram and said the shooting of 'Scam 2003' has begun. Hansal shared an image of the clapboard and wrote, "And we rolled today." 'Scam 2003' will be directed by Tushar Hiranandani. Hansal had directed 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story'. The series will be tentatively named 'Scam 2003: The Curious Case of Abdul Karim Telgi'.

324.title: 6,000 loudspeakers removed, volume of 30,000 speakers lowered in UP
324.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police said that over 6,000 unauthorised loudspeakers were removed from religious places across the state. The volume of other 30,000 loudspeakers was set to permissible limits following a government order, the police added. Prashant Kumar, ADGP (Law and Order), said, "Orders of the High Court regarding loudspeakers are also being considered during the exercise."

325.title: Kejriwal stretches during meet with PM Modi, video goes viral
325.article_body: A video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal stretching and sitting in a relaxed manner with his hands behind his head during PM Narendra Modi's meet with Chief Ministers on COVID-19 situation has gone viral. Sharing the video, BJP criticised Kejriwal and called him "mannerless". "Arvind Kejriwal continues to disgrace himself with uncouth mannerism," tweeted BJP's Amit Malviya.

326.title: BJP-led NDA govt has failed, is a 'non-performing asset': KTR
326.article_body: TRS Working President KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said the BJP-led NDA government has failed on all fronts and has become a "non-performing asset". Even though the NDA government talked about "Aatmanirbhar Bharat" (self-reliant India), there has been no improvement in the living standards of the people, Rao said. TRS should play a key role in national politics, he added.

327.title: Without Gandhi family, there would be no Congress: AK Antony
327.article_body: Senior Congress leader AK Antony on Wednesday stated that the Nehru-Gandhi family is the powerhouse of Congress, without whom, the party wouldn't exist. "Without Congress' role, you cannot think of...change of guard in Delhi," Antony added. His remarks come a day after poll strategist Prashant Kishor declined to join the party, citing a need for leadership overhaul in Congress.

328.title: Electricity deliberately curtailed during sehri & iftar: Ex J&K CM
328.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Wednesday said electricity is deliberately being curtailed at sehri and iftar hours to hassle the Muslim population observing the holy month of Ramadan. He also weighed in on the loudspeaker row and said, "Why can't loudspeakers be allowed at mosques when they're being used in other places?"

329.title: PM wants startup founders to come from tier 2, 3 cities: MoS IT
329.article_body: PM Modi wants the next wave of startup founders to come from tier 2 and tier 3 cities, Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said. He stated, "It's a 100% policy objective [that] digital opportunities are equally available...in Ghaziabad, Jharkhand, Srinagar, Kohima...as much...in Bengaluru." Once 5G gets rolled out, youngsters will "itch" to get into technology sector, he added.

330.title: Constitute a grievance board: Delhi HC to AIIMS over nurses' strike
330.article_body: After All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) nurses called off their strike last night, the Delhi High Court has asked AIIMS to constitute a board for hearing grievances of the employees. "Do not take immediate action. Let things cool down. Take undertaking, set up a board," Justice Yashwant Varma directed AIIMS. You have to strike a balance, he added.

331.title: Apple opens Self Service Repair to iPhone users in US
331.article_body: Apple on Wednesday announced the launch of Self Service Repair in the US. As part of the facility, owners of iPhone 12, 13 and third-generation SE can go through repair manuals, and then buy the parts required to fix common issues with the handsets online. The service will be expanded to additional countries, starting with Europe, later this year.

332.title: Obama loses, Bolsonaro gains followers as Musk buys Twitter: Report
332.article_body: Barack Obama lost 3,00,000 followers while Katy Perry and Taylor Swift lost 2,00,000 and 1,00,000 followers respectively after Elon Musk bought Twitter on Monday, NBC reported. Meanwhile, right-wing politicians including Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro and US Representative Marjorie Greene gained several followers. Responding to the report, Twitter said the "fluctuations" were "organic".

333.title: State govt can't be blamed: Maha CM on PM's remark on high fuel prices
333.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said the state government can't be held responsible for rising fuel prices. He said Maharashtra gets only 5.5% of central taxes even though it contributes 38.3% to direct taxes and 15% to India's GST revenue. This comes after PM Narendra Modi requested several states, including Maharashtra, to cut VAT on petrol and diesel.

334.title: Xiaomi launches Xiaomi 12 Pro 5G in India at starting price of ₹62,999
334.article_body: Xiaomi has launched the Xiaomi 12 Pro 5G in India at a starting price of ₹62,999. The smartphone is equipped with Snapdragon® 8 Gen 1, a 50MP triple rear camera and 4,600 mAh battery that supports 120W fast charging, and comes in the colours Couture Blue, Noir Black and Olive Mauve. The sale will go live on May 2.

335.title: Kirit Somaiya received minor injuries when attacked by Sena workers: Police
335.article_body: Mumbai police said that BJP's Kirit Somaiya received minor injuries after he was attacked by Shiv Sena workers. They added, "Bhabha Hospital in Bandra which treated Kirit Somaiya following the attack stated, 'It was not a major injury. There was minimal bleeding'." Somaiya was attacked when he went to meet MP Navneet Rana and her husband at Khar police station.

336.title: Hindustan Unilever's profit rises 8.6% YoY to ₹2,327 crore in Q4
336.article_body: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) on Wednesday reported an 8.6% rise in its profit after tax from ₹2,143 crore in Q4 FY21 to ₹2,327 crore in Q4 FY22. Its profit in FY22 rose 10.9% YoY to ₹8,818 crore. The company said its revenue from sale of products  in Q4 FY22 came in at ₹13,190 crore, up 10.40% YoY from ₹11,947 crore.

337.title: Delhi reports 1,367 new COVID-19 cases, 14% higher than yesterday
337.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,367 new COVID-19 cases, 14% more than 1,204 fresh cases reported a day ago. As many as 1,042 recoveries and one death from COVID-19 were reported in the last 24 hours. The positivity rate slightly dipped to 4.5% on Wednesday from 4.64% a day ago, according to the Delhi government's daily COVID-19 bulletin.

338.title: WB spent ₹1,500 cr to subsidise fuel prices: CM after fuel price meet
338.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday criticised PM Narendra Modi who urged states to reduce VAT and said that her government has spent ₹1,500 crore in the last three years to subsidise fuel prices. "Today's interaction with PM Modi was completely one-sided and misleading. The facts shared by him were wrong," she said

339.title: Mamata will be real game-changer in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Sinha
339.article_body: Newly-elected Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Shatrughan Sinha praised party supremo Mamata Banerjee and claimed that she could be "real game-changer" in 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Sinha, who won from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency in bypoll, stated that Banerjee is "tried and tested leader who's respected by all". He added that he had left BJP as party turned into an autocracy.

340.title: Kiccha Sudeep responds after Devgn tweets 'Hindi will always be our national language'
340.article_body: Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep responded after Ajay Devgn tweeted that Hindi will "always be our national language" following Sudeep's remark that Hindi is "no more" a national language. "The context to why I said that...is...different," he said, adding he "respects every language". "No offense sir...but was wondering what'd the situation be if my response was typed in Kannada!!" he stated.

341.title: Temperatures rising earlier than usual in country, fire cases rising: PM warns CMs
341.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while interacting with CMs of various states on the COVID-19 situation, said that he'd like to discuss "one more topic". "Temperatures in the country are rising rapidly...and these temperatures are rising earlier than usual...the incidents of fire are increasing," the PM warned. "I request all states to conduct safety audits of hospitals on priority," the PM added.

342.title: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari takes oath as Pak's youngest foreign minister
342.article_body: Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari took oath as 37th Foreign Minister of Pakistan on Wednesday. Bilawal, 33, who was administered oath by President Arif Alvi at Aiwan-i-Sadr (President's House), is reportedly the country's youngest foreign minister. Bilawal was first elected to National Assembly in 2018 but this is the first time he's been inducted into federal cabinet.

343.title: Proud to be sanctioned: UK lawmaker as Russia bars entry to 287 UK MPs
343.article_body: After Russia imposed personal restrictions on 287 UK MPs and banned them from entering the country, senior UK lawmaker Mark Harper said he's proud to be on the list. "Russia really hates being called out for their illegal invasion of Ukraine and disgraceful war crimes," Harper tweeted. Notably, Russia has accused the 287 sanctioned-UK MPs of fuelling "unwarranted Russophobic hysteria".

344.title: Machine Gun Kelly & I consume each other's blood during rituals: Megan
344.article_body: Actress Megan Fox said she and her fiance Machine Gun Kelly consume each other's blood during rituals. "It's just a few drops, but...we do consume each other's blood on occasion for ritual purposes only," Megan stated. "Kelly's much more haphazard...hectic and chaotic, where he's willing to...cut his chest open with broken glass and be like, 'Take my soul'," she added.

345.title: GT to bowl first after SRH lose toss for 1st time in IPL 2022, Washington returns
345.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bowl first against SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. It is the first time that SRH have lost a toss in IPL 2022. SRH have made one change to their playing XI, with Washington Sundar returning after recovering from an injury.

346.title: Kamal Haasan pays his condolences to the families of Thanjavur victims
346.article_body: Kamal Haasan paid his condolences to the families of the victims after 11 people died due to electrocution in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu after a temple chariot came in contact with an electric wire. "District administration...police...local administration should...take...precautionary measures with the festival organizers at such gatherings," Kamal tweeted. 15 people were injured due to the incident.

347.title: Actor Chiranjeevi seen clicking actor-son Ram Charan's pics with fans; people react
347.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi was seen clicking his actor-son Ram Charan's photos with the latter's fans in a video that is doing rounds on social media.
