The video of the father-son duo of actors was taken when they were attending a promotional event. Several Twitter users reacted to the video with tweets like, "Proud moment for father," and "It's a lifetime moment."

348.title: Which Indians have taken the most wickets in T20 cricket?
348.article_body: With his three-wicket haul against RCB, RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin took his tally of wickets in T20 cricket to 271, becoming the highest wicket-taker among Indians in T20 cricket. He overtook Piyush Chawla, who has taken 270 wickets. Yuzvendra Chahal is the third-highest wicket-taker among Indians with 265 wickets, followed by Amit Mishra (262 wickets).

349.title: Russia quits UN tourism body ahead of vote on its suspension: UNWTO
349.article_body: United Nations' World Tourism Organisation (UNWTO) Secretary-General Zurab Pololikashvili on Wednesday said that Russia is withdrawing from the UN's tourism body. Taking to Twitter, Zurab said, "Today, Russia announced their intention to withdraw from UNWTO." The announcement comes ahead of a vote by UNWTO's executive council to suspend Moscow's membership over its invasion of Ukraine.

350.title: Cong revamps Haryana unit, appoints Udai Bhan as state party chief
350.article_body: Congress on Wednesday revamped its Haryana unit and named four-time legislator Udai Bhan as the new state party chief. Bhan replaced Kumari Selja, who tendered her resignation to Congress' high command recently and described herself as a "true soldier" of the party. Additionally, Congress appointed Shruti Choudhry, Ram Kishan Gujjar, Jitender Kumar Bhardwaj and Suresh Gupta as working presidents.

351.title: Won't happen here: T'gana CM as K'taka minister quits over contractor's death
351.article_body:
A few days after Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa resigned over a contractor's death, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao said that such an incident would not take place in Telangana. 
"We have seen a minister losing his ministry in Karnataka but that will not happen in Telangana," KCR said. Contractor Santosh Patil was found dead at a hotel in Udupi.

352.title: Fire due to MCD's negligence: Gopal Rai over Bhalswa fire
352.article_body: A day after a massive fire broke out at Bhalswa landfill in Delhi, Environment Minister Gopal Rai accused the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) of negligence. "The people of Delhi are facing landfill fire due to MCD's negligence and 15 years of BJP's corruption," he said. The Delhi Pollution Control Committee has been asked to submit a report, he added.

353.title: UP official asked to serve mid-day meals to students for delaying RTI reply
353.article_body: In a "symbolic punishment", UP State Information Commission has reportedly asked a Public Information Officer to serve mid-day meals to over 200 students of a primary school in Ghazipur. The punishment was announced after Chandrika Prasad, PIO of Noonra village, delayed in replying to an RTI application. Prasad will have to submit a video of the act to the commission.

354.title: BBMP or BESCOM, no one will be spared: K'taka CM Basavaraj Bommai
354.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai assured probe into the case where a 22-year-old man was electrocuted in Bengaluru and said that no one, be it BBMP or BESCOM, will be spared. "I have asked police officers to probe the matter and we will take necessary action," he said. He added that compensation will be given as per the electricity department norms.

355.title: Video shows Putin's hand shaking uncontrollably amid rumours of Parkinson's disease
355.article_body: Rumours of Russian President Vladimir Putin's failing health have emerged after video footage seemed to show him suffering tremors. New footage of a meeting between him and his Belarusian ally Aleksandr Lukashenko shows Putin hold his arm to his chest in an apparent effort to stop his hand from shaking violently. Rumours have suggested he may have Parkinson's disease.

356.title: Hyd Customs seize gold worth ₹86 lakh concealed in undergarments
356.article_body: Hyderabad Customs officials detected and seized 1614 grams of gold valued at ₹86.42 lakh from a female passenger, who had arrived from Dubai. The officials found gold in paste form concealed in her undergarments. In another incident, customs officials on April 6 had seized gold worth ₹24.820 lakh concealed in a man's trousers and undergarments.

357.title: Tragedy beyond words: President Kovind on electrocution deaths in TN
357.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Wednesday condoled the loss of lives because of electrocution in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur, saying it is a tragedy beyond words. Eleven people, including children, were electrocuted during a temple chariot procession when it came in contact with a high tension transmission line. "I pray for the speedy recovery of the injured," President Kovind tweeted.

358.title: Uniform Civil Code should be implemented, RPI (A) backs it: Athawale
358.article_body: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (A) supremo Ramdas Athawale said on Wednesday that party backs Uniform Civil Code (UCC) and will support it when it's tabled in parliament. "I think...there should be a common law for all," he added. Athawale's remarks come amid the proposed implementation of the UCC by some BJP-ruled states, including Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh.

359.title: Is it proper to use 'jumla' for PM: Delhi HC on Khalid's bail plea
359.article_body: While hearing the bail application of student activist Umar Khalid, the Delhi High Court on Wednesday asked whether it was proper to use the term 'jumla' regarding the PM of India. The court said that a "lakshman rekha" has to be there for criticising the government. "Criticism of the government cannot become a crime," said senior advocate Trideep Pais.

360.title: Actor Kenneth Tsang found dead in Hong Kong's COVID-19 quarantine hotel
360.article_body: Kenneth Tsang, the 86-year-old veteran Hong Kong actor who was also a familiar face on Singapore television, was found dead on Wednesday at a hotel in Hong Kong. He was undergoing the city's mandatory travel quarantine for COVID-19 at the hotel after returning from Singapore on Monday, reports said. He had tested negative for COVID-19 on Tuesday, the reports added.

361.title: Australian inflation hits 20-yr high, petrol prices rise 35%
361.article_body: Australia's annual inflation rate hit 5.1% in Q1 2022, from 3.5% the previous quarter and the highest rate since 2001. While petrol prices gained 35%, cost of new dwellings climbed a record 13.7% and food prices also picked up. This could make the Reserve Bank of Australia raise interest rates from record lows ahead of the federal election, Reuters reported.

362.title: Indian photographer's pic of Srinagar kebab seller wins int'l food photo contest
362.article_body: Indian photographer Debdatta Chakraborty has been named the overall winner of Pink Lady Food Photographer of the Year 2022. Titled 'Kebabiyana', the photograph taken in Srinagar showed a kebab seller on a busy street at night. "This image, gentle but powerful, nourishes our soul," Caroline Kenyon, the founder of the award, said.

363.title: 2016 EgyptAir flight crash that killed 66 caused by pilot's lit cigarette, probe finds
363.article_body: The 2016 EgyptAir flight crash that killed 66 was caused by a pilot smoking a cigarette, an investigation found. The Airbus A320 plane was travelling from France to Egypt in May 2016 when it crashed into the sea south of Crete. The cigarette inadvertently ignited oxygen leaking from an emergency gas mask leading to the fire and crash, probe found.

364.title: 3 students critical as lift collapses at IMS college in Ghaziabad
364.article_body: At least eight students were injured after the lift they were in collapsed at an engineering college in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. Three students are said to be critical. "Eight students reported injuries after a lift fell in the IMS college in Dasna, Ghaziabad," a senior police official said. He added that all students were admitted to a nearby hospital.

365.title: ED attaches ₹6.17 cr of fintech firms linked to Chinese nationals
365.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached ₹6.17 crore lying in bank and payment gateway accounts linked to fintech firms and individuals, including Chinese nationals, accused of lending money at usurious rates during the pandemic. According to ED, the accused issued loans and raised investments through mobile apps. The firms were registered on Chinese nationals' instructions.

366.title: PM quoting only Opposition-ruled states to reduce VAT on fuel: DMK
366.article_body: DMK's TKS Elangovan accused PM Narendra Modi of quoting only opposition-ruled states to reduce taxes on fuel. "[PM Modi] won't say that Gujarat or Karnataka should reduce taxes," Elangovan said. This comes after PM Modi urged governments of Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Jharkhand and Tamil Nadu to reduce VAT on fuel during his meeting with the CMs.

367.title: It's any actress' dream: Urvashi Rautela on sharing screen with SRK
367.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela was recently spotted at Baba Siddique's Iftar party, which was also attended by celebrities including Shah Rukh Khan. When asked if she'd like to work with actor Shah Rukh Khan, Urvashi said, "I would really wish and wait for the opportunity to share screen opposite Shahrukh Khan. It's any actress' dream. Hope that happens soon."

368.title: Shweta responds to trolls in new post, asks 'Tere baap ka kya jaata hai'
368.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari has responded to trolls who question her for laughing too much in pictures with a new post on Instagram. The actress shared pictures of herself laughing and captioned it, "They (trolls): 'Itna kya hans rahi hai! (Why are you laughing so much) Us: 'tere Baap ka kya jaata hai (what has your father got to lose)'."

369.title: Russia-backed Moldovan breakaway region says shots fired from Ukraine
369.article_body: Moldova's pro-Russian breakaway region of Transdniestria claimed on Wednesday that shots from Ukraine were fired towards its village Cobasna, which houses an ammunition depot. Transdniestria further claimed that several Ukrainian drones had been detected flying over Cobasna. This comes days after Moldova accused Russia of seeking to recruit its citizens from the region to fight in Ukraine war.

370.title: Don't oppose every step just to appear on TV: Mann to Opposition
370.article_body: Reacting to Opposition's criticism on Knowledge Sharing Agreement signed between Delhi-Punjab government, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said, "Opposition parties should not oppose every step being taken just to appear on TV." "Opposition parties should give us time," he added. "Navjot Singh Sidhu is questioning us on Power Purchase Agreements. When he was made Power Minister, he ran away," Mann said.

371.title: Malaysia to lift COVID-19 curbs including outdoor mask rule from May
371.article_body: Malaysia's Health Minister Khairy Jamaluddin on Wednesday said that the country will ease more COVID-19 restrictions, including scrapping the need to wear masks outdoors from the start of May. He, however, said that masks will remain mandatory for indoor activities and on public transport. People will now be able to enter public premises regardless of their vaccination status, Jamaluddin added.

372.title: Ram Charan visits Vijayawada's Kanakadurgamma Temple ahead of Acharya's release
372.article_body: Ram Charan and director Koratala Siva visited the Kanakadurgamma Temple in Vijayawada to offer prayers before Acharya's release on April 29. While the 'RRR' actor wore an all-black kurta pyjama look yet again, Siva was clicked in a semi-formal look with a shirt and denim. Yesterday, actors Chiranjeevi and Ram Charan were spotted in Hyderabad to promote 'Acharya'.

373.title: There's no action hero of my age in H'wood, want to try my luck there: Tiger
373.article_body: Tiger Shroff said there's a void in terms of a young action hero in Hollywood, adding "[There are] Tom Cruise and Jackie Chan, but there isn't any action hero...of my age group." "It's been a while since [I've] seen somebody with that skill set...portraying action or the kind of action I do...But that's my goal...to...try my luck in...Hollywood," he said.

374.title: Greece to help neighbour Bulgaria after Russia cuts gas supply
374.article_body: Greece will help Bulgaria deal with the new situation caused by the Russian decision to halt gas supplies to the country, Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis told his Bulgarian counterpart Kiril Petkov during a phone call. Petkov said that Mitsotakis has assured him that a long-delayed gas link between the two neighbours, the Interconnector Greece-Bulgaria (IGB), will be ready by June.

375.title: Give Karim Benzema the Ballon d'Or: Ex-Real Madrid player Mesut Özil
375.article_body: Reacting to Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema's brace in the first leg of Real Madrid's Champions League semi-final against Manchester City, ex-Real Madrid player Mesut Özil tweeted, "Give...Benzema the Ballon d'Or." Manchester City defeated Real Madrid 4-3 in the first leg with Kevin De Bruyne, Gabriel Jesus, Phil Foden and Bernardo Silva scoring for City.

376.title: BJP never promotes riots but stops them: Madhya Pradesh Minister
376.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Cabinet Minister and BJP leader Vishvas Kailash Sarang has said that "BJP never promotes riots but stops them". This comes after Congress' Digvijaya Singh alleged that BJP is paying poor Muslim youth to pelt stones, adding, "These aren't facts...I'm not accusing anyone." Reacting to Singh's statement, Sarang asked, "How could you level such charges when you...don't have proof."

377.title: I'm bravest actor, what have I left that someone else could do: Ayushmann
377.article_body: When asked about who he thinks is the bravest actor, Ayushmann Khurrana named himself and said he thinks he's the bravest of all. "Whom should I name who can be called braver than me...what have I left that...someone else could have done or thought of doing? But I envy certain characters like Ranbir Kapoor in Rockstar and Barfi," he added.

378.title: Focus should be on stopping fighting: Jaishankar on Ukraine war
378.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the best way to deal with the Ukraine conflict would be to focus on "stopping the fighting and getting the talking" to move forward. He added that India's position on the crisis is best placed to advance such an approach. India has not yet publicly condemned Russia's invasion and has called for dialogue-based resolution.

379.title: I always say that: Salah on whether he is the world's best player
379.article_body: Talking about whether he believes he is the best player in the world, Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah said, "In my mind, yes, I am always saying that...I don't choose anyone other than me." Salah is currently the highest goal-scorer in the ongoing 2021/22 season of the Premier League, having scored 22 goals so far. He has recorded 13 assists.

380.title: BJP targeting the NCP, misusing ED and CBI: Supriya Sule
380.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule accused the BJP of targeting the NCP and misusing Central agencies such as ED and CBI against its political opponents. "How is raking up issues like loudspeakers at places of worship going to benefit Maharashtra?" she questioned the BJP. Polarisation through communal unrest would only impact the country's economic growth and development, she added.

381.title: Political asylum only for homeless, I have home in Cong: KV Thomas
381.article_body: Congress leader KV Thomas on Wednesday rejected CPI(M) Kerala secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan's invitation to join the party, stating that he has a home in Congress, adding that political asylum is for the homeless. "Party positions are like tables and chairs. If that is taken away and I am given a stool, I have no problem with that," he said.

382.title: Man tries to sacrifice daughter for treasure in Maha; 9 arrested
382.article_body: Police have arrested nine persons for allegedly trying to sacrifice an 18-year-old in order to find hidden treasure in Maharashtra's Yavatmal. The victim's father had started performing tantrik rituals over the last few days and had dug a pit to bury his daughter, an official said. The victim somehow managed to inform her friend who subsequently informed the police.

383.title: K'taka Home Minister protecting PSI scam accused: DK Shivakumar
383.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Wednesday alleged that state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra is protecting the main accused in the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "Government should give a notice to Jnanendra...for providing protection to Divya Hagaragi (prime accused)," he said. CM Basavaraj Bommai had earlier said that everything related to the PSI scam would be probed.

384.title: 'Mohammadpur is Madhavpuram now': Delhi BJP chief puts up board
384.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Wednesday said that the name of south Delhi's Mohammadpur village has been changed to Madhavpuram. He said that since the Aam Aadmi Party-led government did not act on the proposal submitted by the South Delhi Municipal Corporation in December, the party members have renamed the place on their own.

385.title: China opposes US warship’s passage through Taiwan Strait
385.article_body: The People's Liberation Army (PLA) of China on Wednesday released a statement opposing the passage of a US warship - USS Sampson guided-missile destroyer - through the Taiwan Strait. "The US has been frequently carrying out provocative acts to send wrong signals to 'Taiwan Independence' forces, deliberately undermining peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait," said the statement.

386.title: Sadhguru is on global tour, he didn't meet Will Smith: Sadhguru's team
386.article_body: After several reports claimed that Hollywood star Will Smith was recently in India to meet Sadhguru after the Chris Rock slap controversy, Sadhguru's media relations team confirmed that the news isn't true. They said, "Sadhguru is on a global tour to promote Save Soil Movement. Sadhguru has not met Will Smith recently."

387.title: There’s probably a lot of people praying for my downfall: Naomi Osaka
387.article_body: Ex-world number one Naomi Osaka tweeted that probably there are a lot of people "praying [for her] downfall", but she doesn't feel it as the love overpowers everything. Osaka is a four-time Grand Slam champion. She is the first Japanese tennis player to win Australian Open having won the tournament in 2019. Osaka has played in four tournaments in 2022.

388.title: Instagram tests feature to let users pin posts to their profile
388.article_body: Instagram is testing a new feature to let users pin specific posts to their profile above their photo grid. Users who have access to the feature in the test phase are seeing a 'Pin to your profile' option that can be selected from the three-dot menu next to posts. Currently, users have the option to pin Stories to their profiles.

389.title: Chandigarh to seek French experts' help to protect 12,000 heritage items
389.article_body: The Chandigarh Administration has decided to ask for help from French experts in preserving and protecting its 12,000 heritage items. Reports said that the heritage items may be sold abroad for lakhs. "We will seek their help and have detailed discussion on the issue...we will ask them to help us technologically to protect the items," UT Adviser Dharam Pal said.

390.title: Power company engineer held for taking bribe in Madhya Pradesh
390.article_body: A junior engineer of a government-owned power company was caught red-handed while taking bribe to settle an electricity-related case in Madhya Pradesh on Wednesday. The accused, identified as Virendra Singh Chouhan, was posted in Narsinghpur. According to an EOW official, Chouhan had allegedly demanded ₹15,000 to settle a case related to seizure of electric wires from the complainant's farm.

391.title: Syria's humanitarian situation remains dire amid economic crisis: UN
391.article_body: The UN deputy emergency relief coordinator, Joyce Msuya, on Tuesday said humanitarian situation in Syria remains dire amid a worsening economic crisis in the country. Msuya said, "As the eyes of the world turn to other conflicts, Syria is on the verge of becoming yet another forgotten crisis despite millions of Syrians struggling each month to survive."

392.title: Denmark arrests man for promoting Islamic State on social media
392.article_body:
A man was arrested on Wednesday in Denmark on suspicion of violating the country's anti-terrorism laws by allegedly promoting the Islamic State group on social media. Police gave no other details except 
that the domestic security agency PET was involved in the operation. Last month, PET had said that Denmark's "biggest terrorist threat" remains people who sympathise with Islamic militants.

393.title: Man rapes cow in UP, arrested after neighbour finds CCTV footage
393.article_body: A man in Lucknow has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a cow. The complainant alleged that the man was seen having sex with the cow on Saturday in CCTV footage. The neighbour then informed the owner of the cow after which a search party was formed by the locals to apprehend the accused.

394.title: 17-year-old Pune girl found 3-month pregnant, rape case filed against husband, father
394.article_body: Pune Police filed a case of rape and invoked anti-child marriage legislation after receiving report from a government hospital of a 17-year-old girl being three months pregnant. Police have booked the girl's 19-year-old husband and father. Police said that they have provided counsellor support to the girl and were in contact with both families to sensitively deal with the situation.

395.title: Only mom & I live in my mansion, I wander in the house at night: Nawazuddin
395.article_body: In a new video posted by RJ Siddharth Kannan, he gave a quick tour of Nawazuddin Siddiqui's Mumbai mansion. The video also included audio clips of their conversation about the actor's home. In the clip, Nawazuddin is heard saying, "Only my mother and I live in this house. At night, when I'm unable to sleep...I wander around like a ghost."

396.title: I will choose Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in my team: Kaka
396.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid footballer Kaka said he will choose Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in his team, adding that the chances of Ronaldo's failure are very less as he is very determined and focused. "Messi is a genius and Ronaldo has a very strong mentality," stated Kaka. Ronaldo currently represents Manchester United having earlier played for Real Madrid and Juventus.

397.title: Stopped from thrashing wife, UP man sets mom ablaze; consumes poison
397.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi allegedly set his 60-year-old mother on fire after she stopped him from thrashing his wife. The accused, Mahajan, later consumed poison himself. While his mother died, Mahajan is struggling for life. Reports said Mahajan used to pressure his mother to empty her room as he wanted to stay there with his wife and children.

398.title: Why do you dub your movies in Hindi if it's not our national language: Ajay to Sudeep
398.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has reacted to Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep's remark that Hindi is "no more" a national language. Ajay tweeted, "According to you, if Hindi is not our national language then why do you release your mother tongue movies by dubbing them in Hindi?" Ajay added, "Hindi was, is and always will be our mother tongue and national language."

399.title: 'Hobbit' human ancestors may be hiding on Indonesian island: Anthropologist
399.article_body: An anthropologist retired from the University of Alberta has claimed that "Hobbit" human ancestors or Homo floresiensis may still be hiding on an Indonesian island. Studies over the years concluded that they went extinct some 12,000 years ago. Gregory Forth's book includes sighting reports from over 30 eyewitnesses, with whom he spoke directly.

400.title: ‘Heropanti 2’ is not muddy and dirty, every frame is slick: Tiger Shroff
400.article_body: Talking about his upcoming film ‘Heropanti 2’, actor Tiger Shroff said, “‘Heropanti 2’ is not muddy and dirty, every frame is slick.” “It has the vibe of say ‘Mission Impossible’ meets ‘James Bond’ meets ‘War’,” added Tiger. Discussing movies from the ‘Baaghi’ franchise in which he stars as well, Tiger stated that ‘Baaghi’ was raw and rustic.
